strIntroduction: "Fuji-san in west, Tsukuba-san in east" Tsukuba-san (Mount Tsukuba) is referred as one of the best 100 Japanese mountains, similarly to Mount Fuji. It is also famous as a relatively easy to climb mountain because it is only 877-meter high. Tukuba Shrine is one of the most famous shrines in Japan. More than 200,000 worshipers go there every year. There are a lot of beautiful trees like plums (Ume), cherry trees (Sakura) and autumn color leaves. You will be able to enjoy the beautiful mountain view and the natural landscape. Tsukubasan has ropeway and a cable car so that you can enjoy the landscape and the fresh air. Recommended course: Enjoy shrine and landscape by vehicles. Tsukuba Station-Bus (40 min)-Miyawaki bus stop ->Tsukuba Shrine (30 min) Pray, check charm and stamp book, etc. ->Cable car (8 min)-Miyukigahara (Top field: 60 min. Restaurants) Walk to "Nyotai-san" (Top of Mt Tsukuba: 20min one way) Lucky stone throwing ->Rope way (6 min)-Bus (50 min)-Tsukuba Station Total 3 hours and 40 minutes. -Additional fees to pay on the day for transportation (Bus, Cable car, Ropeway) Adult: 2,620 JPY Child: 1,320 JPY Hiking course: If you want to enjoy hiking, please add 3-4 hours more (Total 6-7 hours). -Shirakumohashi course (up 110 min/ down 95 min) Benkei nanamodori, Hokutoiwa rock -Miyukigahara course(up 90 min/ down 70 min) Minanogawa river, Cable car passing More information: -Flower season Plum (Ume): Feburary to March Cherry (Sakura): end of March to mid-April Autumn leaves: end of October to end of November Vehicle timetables: Tsukuba Station 1st 6:55-7:38 from Station to Shrine last 21:20-22:03 from Shrine to Station Cable car 9:20-17:40 Rope way 9:00-18:20
strTitle: Visit a dignified shrine and explore Mt Tsukuba

strIntroduction: Hi, there! First of all, let me introduce myself below: I'm a racing driver competing in various races - single seaters, touring cars, and kart racing. I can communicate in English, Chinese, and Japanese. I hope you will enjoy the kart racing experience I provide! :) About the experience: 1. Duration of the experience: Approximately 1 hour except transferring time 2. Booking: Group or single guest 3. What to bring: Nothing (No license required) 4. Includes: 3 laps → rest → 5 laps (Totally 8 laps) *Not including foods and transferring cost 5. Other: Basically, the experience is carried out even if it rains or shines except during a storm. If you have any questions, please feel free to contact me always. This experience is held in Osaka only
strTitle: Try kart racing in Osaka, Japan!

strIntroduction: If you come to Nagano, visiting Zenkoji is a must to do. This walk gives you an opportunity to do a little more; either try Zazen (zen meditation) or try making a Kaleidoscope by yourself for your memory. First, we will meet at Nagano Station, and then you can choose to walk to Zenkoji (about 20 minutes) or take a bus to get to the gate to Zenkoji (public transportation). We will pass the gates and visit inside the temple. We can walk around the precincts and may try Okaidan Meguri, which is said to connect you with Buddha. (This may not be available when construction is going on or it is extremely crowded.) Then, we will take a look at the shops on the Sando (approach). There are many souvenir shops where you can pick up gifts to bring back home. We will visit a shukubo (inn) to try Zen meditation. Zazen is a type of meditation that is practiced by zen monks. You will sit in a certain posture and stay single-mindedly, breathe and be aware, to be free from all sorts of delusions and desires. It will be a great experience for you. Or, You can try out making a Kaleidoscope at an art shop located in a shukubo. It is made easy to do and you will enjoy showing your own creativity, not to mention you will have a great souvenir for yourself. The tour cost includes lunch or tea/coffee break, depending on the time.
strTitle: Visit Zenkoji Temple & Experience Zazen or Make Crafts

strIntroduction: Togakushi is located at the mountainous area north of Nagano city, which is a part of Myoko Togakushi Renzan National Park. This area has been famous for a Shinto shrine called "Togakushi-jinja" that was the center of ascetic practices as well as Ninja's training. We will meet at Nagano Station, and take a train to Kurohime. Then we will drive to Togakushi area. First, we will see Togakushi-jinja's Chusha, one of the most popular shrines. After that, we either walk or drive to Okusha area. Okusha and Kuzuryusha are located next to each other, but the approach to these shrines are about 2 km, and it is partly uphill, so it is recommended that you wear comfortable shoes! On the way to Okusha, you will find beautiful cedar trees on each side of the approach, as well as Zuijinmon, a shrine gate with a thatched roof beautifully colored in vermilion. Also, you will hear birds singing and see peaceful nature with trees and rivers. After that, we will visit Togakushi Folk Museum that introduces a collection of antiques and Ninja accessories. There is also Ninja karakuri House. "Karakuri" means "tricks", so you will find Ninja's tricks inside. Enjoy exploring inside just like you are a Ninja! Togakushi is one of the most famous areas for its soba (buckwheat) noodles. You can enjoy soba noodles at one of the local restaurants. If you would like to try making soba by yourself, you can choose to visit Soba Museum instead of going to the Folk Museum and Ninja House. At the Soba Museum, you can experience making soba and eat it after that for your lunch.
strTitle: Explore Togakushi Shrines & Ninja House in Nagano

strIntroduction: This tour is available from May 1st ~ Nov 30th. The tour starts with a hike through a beautiful forest and past several lakes. Discover various types of wild plants and flowers as you walk along the hiking trail to Kagami-ike Lake with its stunning view of Mt. Togakushi. On days with no wind, you can see Mt. Togakushi reflected on the water's surface. You will also pass by a panoramic spot where you can enjoy a view of the Japanese Alps. After a 2 hour hike, it is time for a lunch of Soba, or buckwheat noodles in English. It is a traditional dish for people in Nagano, and Togakushi especially is known for the distinctive taste of their soba made with region's clean mountain water. The dish comes with shrimp and seasonal vegetables tempura. After lunch, take the bus to the entrance of pilgrimage path to the Togakushi Okusha Shrine. While the entire Togakushi area is regarded as sacred to followers of Shintoism, Togakushi Okusha Shrine is the most important place within the region and the very end of the regional pilgrimage. Approximately 300 Cryptomeria trees are lined beautifully along the pilgrimage path. It is more than impressive enough to make visitors ponder the sacredness of Japanese Shintoism. After walking back from the Okusha Shrine, it is time for some recreation and learning at the Ninja Folklore Museum. At the museum, you will not only learn about the history and techniques used by the Togakushi ninja, you can also give escaping a ninja house filled with hidden doors and tricks a go. Tour itinerary: 09:00 Meet at Nagano station directly in front of the Shinkansen exit at the information board towards the East Exit. - Take the bus towards Togakushi. - Start the hike through the forest trail with several ponds and mountain views. 12:45 Eat lunch at a local soba restaurant - Take the bus to Togakushi Shrine and walk past the Japanese cedars. - Go to the Ninja House that also holds a Ninja Folklore Museum. 17:07 Go back by bus to Nagano Station. 18:20 Arrive back at Nagano Station.
strTitle: 1-Day Togakushi Nature Trekking and Ninja tour

strIntroduction: This activity offers the experience to cook rice in a traditional way, using an old rice cooker which is very rare in people’s lives now. Although the rice made in this way is still considered as the best, almost all the people use an electric rice cooker and so it is even rare for Japanese people to experience this way of cooking rice. In addition, the guests will use traditional fireplace to grill famous Hida Beef. What makes this activity more attractive are 1) the lecturer is a very experienced, 70-year old mother in the region who knows everything unique to the region; 2) the guest room, where the guests will eat lunch, is one of the oldest houses in Hida with high cultural values.
strTitle: Have a Traditional Lunch Experience in Hida-Takayama Area

strIntroduction: The concept of this cooking class is designed for guests to experience the lives and culture of locals in the Hida Takayama area. This cooking class begins by escaping from the hustle and bustle that is Takayama to Hida Furukawa. You will then enter a local host's beautiful home where the class will be held. You can learn how to make local food and ask questions about not only food but also regarding the locals' lifestyle and culture. The lecturer is not a professional chef but an experienced home cook who is passionate about food and speaking English. Having lived in Australia, she speaks English well, making it easy for the guests to enjoy communicating with the lecturer. The class size is limited to 6 people in order to make sure to keep a personalized experience. During the class, all recipes and ingredients will be handed out to the guests so that the guests can recreate it. The class will usually have the following menu: 2 side dishes 1 main dish Miso soup Rice steamed with vegetables Dessert *Menu is subject to change
strTitle: Enjoy Cooking Class In Japan's Countryside at a Local House

strIntroduction: This is a two hour long bus tour of Tokyo. Ride on an amphibious bus and enjoy the sights both from land and water! The Sky Duck, the amphibious bus operated by the Hinomaru Limousine Group takes you around the Sky Tree and Kameido area, where you'll be able to see post-war era homes, stores and popular ramen and gyoza restaurants. The tour has two different routes available. The first route, called the Sky Tree course starts at the Tokyo Sky Tree. A broadcast tower complex with restaurants and an observation deck. It is the tallest tower and the second tallest structure in the world. The bus will then splash into the Nakagawa river to continue the tour on water! The second route, called the Kameido course, begins at the newly built Kameido Umeyashiki, a beautiful mansion built in the style of the wealthy Edo period homes. The bus will then splash into the Nakagawa river to continue the tour on water! The tour departs from the Sky Tree Station Office at the following time slots: 09:10, 11:25, 13:25 and 15:25
strTitle: Explore Tokyo by bus and boat with this amphibious bus tour!

strIntroduction: In this 5-hour bus tour, you can visit Kyoto's best 3 tourist attractions which are the Kinkakuji, Ginkakuji, and Kiyomizudera Temples at an excellent price. Don't miss this opportunity to fully experience Kyoto's traditional culture by visiting these popular sightseeing spots! The Kinkakuji Temple, also known as the Golden Pavilion, or Rokuonji, is one of the most popular spots for tourists. A Zen buddhist temple, it has also been selected as one of the Historic Monuments of Ancient Kyoto by the UNESCO World Heritage organization. In addition to being designated as a National Special Historic Site it has also been designated a National Special Landscape. With its fascinating and gorgeous appearance of shining gold, the Kinkakuji has attracted millions of visitors. So, if you are fascinated by the Kinkakuji, don't hesitate to reserve this tour. The Ginkakuji Temple, officially named Jishoji, is one of the constructions that represents Higashiyama culture from the Muromachi period. The garden around the Ginkakuji is famous for its beautiful scenery and when you get to Sengetsusen, which is the small waterfall in the temple, you may see many coins thrown in the water like the Trevi Fountain in Italy. In Japanese, there is a famous expression "to jump off the stage at Kiyomizu", which is equivalent of the English expression"to take the plunge". This expression comes from the Kiyomizudera Temple which is also included in this tour. The Hondo (main hall) of this temple is known as the "stage" of Kiyomizudera and from its 18m high cliff you can see the panoramic view of Kyoto city. If you join this tour, you can explore the 3 best temples in Kyoto and learn about its history. The tour is very popular so it's best to hurry up and reserve your seats before they sell out! This tour is available everyday until March 17th, 2017. The bus will depart at 09:00, 10:30, 11:30. Notice: The bus departing at 11:30 will only be available on Saturdays, Sundays and national holidays. Although, it will be operated everyday from December 31st to January 3rd, it will not be operated from January 4th to February 28th.
strTitle: Explore the 3 Best Tourist Attractions in Kyoto!

strIntroduction: Iwamura is a small town in Ena city, located in the southeast part of Gifu prefecture. Its roots can be traced back to the Edo period (17-19th century). Iwamura then fell into obscurity, allowing many of its houses and shops to remain relatively unchanged. Enjoy visiting an unaltered and unadulterated part of Japan. Meet your guide at Ena Station at 9:00 am and take a local train, Akechi railways, for Iwamura town. Along the way you can see beautiful nature and rice fields from the train. It is about a thirty minute train trip. (The departure time at Ena station is 9:28 am on weekends and holidays and 9:15 am on weekdays. The arrival time at Iwamura station is 9:57 am on weekends and holidays and 9:44 am on weekdays.) Walk to the main street of Iwamura castle town. It has been selected as "Important Preservation District Groups of Historic Buildings". The streets also have been selected as one of the best 100 beautiful historical landscapes in Japan. Visit the Kimura house which preserves the style of the Edo period. Visit Tosaya's house which was a shop for dyeing kimono. You can learn the unique ideas and skills of the ancient people in the town. Katukawa's house belonged to one of the local rich families. After the walking tour, we will make Japanese zori sandals together out of recycled-shirt fabric and kimono silk — a comfortable and fashionable souvenir. The instructor will teach you how to make it. We will have late lunch at one of the local restaurants after making sandals. Enjoy delicious local foods and sweets with traditional manufacturing. Go to the local sake brewery, Onna-joshu, at the end and see various sake brands. Take the local train for Ena at 4:45 pm when the tour ends.
strTitle: Make Japanese sandals in historical castle town Iwamura

strIntroduction: What you can enjoy in this one day tour to Ibaraki's countryside: - You will enjoy visiting the tallest statue of standing Buddha in the world. - You will climb up to the chest of the statue from where you can enjoy the panorama scenery (extra fee) - You can enjoy rabbit feeding and monkey tricks in front of the statue (extra fee) - After seeing the statue, we will enjoy shopping at the shopping mall near the statue. There are brand shop like Coach, A.v.v, Levi's, Polo Ralph Lauren, Ray-Ban, etc. The tour duration will be 3-4 hours. Pick up by car is available from Tsukuba Station, JR Tsuchiura Station or any nearby station (hotel) Optional fees (please pay on the day): - 800 JPY: climb inside the statue, garden and rabbit feeding - 500 JPY: garden and rabbit feeding only
strTitle: Visit Ushiku Daibutsu and enjoy shopping in Ibaraki!

strIntroduction: You will visit many popular and historic places by bicycle and you can experience and feel Japanese culture and traditions all in one day! Make your own souvenir leather key holders at the leather factory which goes back three generations. Take coffee break at Japanese coffe roastery in Kiyosumishirakawa. Kiyosumishirakawa is a famous erea for Third-wave coffee nowadays. There are some nice Japanese coffee roastaries there. Make your original Shichimi. Shichimi is Japanese traditional spice. The special blender blends Shichimi in response to your requests. Sightsee at a 100% organic Green Tea shop. This Green Tea shop is running by Green Tea farmer. You can drink and buy some fresh Green teas. Also it is very good for souvenir. Course: CYT→Kuramaebashi Bridge→Sumidagawa River→Sumidagawa Terrace→Kiyosumishirakawa→Higashimukoujima→Kuramae→KappaBashi→Asakusa→CYT
strTitle: Cycle around Tokyo's streets and craft shops

strIntroduction: Even beginners will be able to participate and enjoy this cultural activity! It's the doubly pleasant experience, which involves experiencing colors, that you can take home and use. Use both hands, and become an Artist!! The activity lasts 2-hours. (※Depends on the person, you might finish early.) One by one you will apply to make a gradation, and give the pattern a three-dimensional effect. You will finish after you get home, by washing the rice glue off by water. The washing work is the most pleasant stage of the work in Bingata. You will see final result of what you dyed for the first time after you have washed all the rice glue out. You'll be impressed with it! ■Choose the starting time: - from 2 pm to 4 pm - from 5 pm to 7 pm ■Choose the materials: - A greeting card made of Japanese paper "Gettoushi" (A5 size) - An eco‐friendly bag, 100% cotton (A4 size) ■Choose the design: -The king of humpback whale -A classical style of flowers In this activity you will have the unique chance to try the Japanese traditional handicraft "Bingata" dyeing in Okinawa. ■Bingata stands for Japanese textile. Originally, it was dyed in the Ryukyu Dynastic Period for Shinto ritual clothing, and clothing for royalty, for the best clothes of ordinary people, and for Ryukyu dancers to help foster (develop) warm diplomatic relations. It mixes techniques of Yuzen and chintz through the Silk Road. --------------------------------------------------- Public Transportation Access: - By Bus: You can take a bus from Naha city to Uruma city. Take a bus #110, and get off at the bus stop "Uruma shimin geijutsu gekijou mae". It will take 2 hours or so from Naha city. You can walk to my place from the bus stop in about 3 minutes time. I can pick you up at the bus stop. -By Car: You will be able to park for free in front of the building.
strTitle: Experience "Bingata" dyeing traditional craft in Okinawa

strIntroduction: Enjoy a half-day afternoon tour to visit Nijo Castle and Ryoanji Temple, where you can enjoy exploring the ancient culture and the famous architecture objects of Kyoto. You will be visiting Nijo Castle, a castle built by Tokugawa Ieyasu as his residence in Kyoto in 1603. Nijo Castle is a National Treasure of Japan, with 3,300 square meters floor area and 33 rooms. The castle is filled with the essence of grand and gorgeous Momoyama culture, including drawings on fusuma and sculptures by Kano Tanyu. The garden of the castle was designed by Kobori Enshu, a skillful garden architect. You will also be visiting Ryoanji Temple, which is a temple of Rinzai Myoshinji Sect. It was also originally a villa of Tokudaiji Saneyoshi, and in 1450 (approximately 565 years ago), Katsumoto Hosokawa inherited the place and established the property. Its Karesansui garden, with 15 stones placed on white sand, which describes a landscape of mountains and water using only stones and sand without ponds, etc., is globally famous. It was designated as the World Heritage Site in December 1994. This tour departs from the Karasuma Exit of JR Kyoto station at 13:30 and the length of the tour is approximately 3 hours.
strTitle: Half Day Tour to Nijo Castle & Ryoanji Temple in Kyoto!

strIntroduction: Enjoy a half-day morning tour to visit Sanjusangendo and Fushimi Inari Taisha Shrine, where you can enjoy exploring the ancient architectures and learning the culture and the teaching of Buddhism. You will be visiting Sanjusangendo, which is also called as Renge-ouin is a Buddhist temple located in Higashiyama District of Kyoto. The temple name literally means "Hall with 33 spaces between columns", describing the architecture of the long main hall of the temple. The number 33 is applied based on the teaching of Buddhism, which means One Kannon Goddess transform herself into 33 figures to offer mercy to people. Inside the main building, there are a sitting statue of Chuson Senju Kannon, with 500 of standing statues of thousand armed kannon on its both side. This temple now has been designated as a National Treasure of Japan. You will also be visiting Fushimi Inari Taisha Shrine, which was established approximately 1300 years ago, when the God of Inari was enshrined in 711, by Hatanoirogu at Sangamine of Inari Mountain. These days, the God of the Shrine has been accepted widely as a God of wellness and wealth, that enhances the businesses, productiveness of grains, and well-being of the families. At Fushimi Inari Shrine, you can enjoy approximately 10,000 red Torii gates standing from Okumiya to Okusha, that continues along a footpath that stretches to the top of the mountain. In Japan, there are approximately 30,000 Inari Shrines, and Fushimi Inari Shrine is the head of all these Shrines. This tour departs from the Karasuma Exit of JR Kyoto station at 9:50 and the length of the tour is approximately 2.5 hours.
strTitle: Half Day Tour to Sanjusangendo & Fushimi Inari Taisha Shrine

strIntroduction: Enjoy the amazing scenery of warm beaches and blue skies of Okinawa in a fun, creative way in a Go-kart. Besides enjoying the sights, you'll experience the thrill of reliving your favorite video games speeding around the streets of Okinawa. You can drive individually or in a group, and although the speed is only about 50 km/h, the experience is still very thrilling because of the low center of gravity, and don't worry, the staff will teach you how to handle the karts. You can decide how long you want to rent yours 1, 2, 3, or 5 hours or even a whole day. Please note: 1.You must have a valid Japanese or Japanese SOFA license, or International Driving Permit based on the 1949 Geneva Convention*. 2. Bring a valid Japanese or Japanese SOFA license, or International Driving Permit* and a copy of your passport (passport is not required for Japanese) to the shop on the day. 3. All karts are for 1-person. There are no multi-person karts. Each guest must have one a valid Japanese or Japanese SOFA license, or International Driving Permit. 4. A Japanese driver's license (first-class driver's license for normal vehicles) or international driving permit and a copy of your passport is required. 5. You can cancel without paying any cancellation fee up to a month. Please return the kart on time, otherwise an additional fare will be charged. 6. Do not wear high heels or clothing that can can be inconvenient or cause accidents. 7. Please return the kart with a full tank of gas. *Holders of a license from Belgium, France, Germany, Monaco, Slovenia, Switzerland or Taiwan can use an official Japanese translation provided by the Japan Automobile Federation (JAF) or the country’s embassy or consulate in Japan. The tour may be cancelled due to the rain. We will inform you 1 day prior to the activity if the tour cancelled and proceed to refund. How to get from Naha to Chatan area: Express Bus -From Naha: 06:40 - 19:50 It takes about 1.5 hours one way. Take bus number 20, 28, 29, 120 or 62 from central Naha. The stop is Carnival Park Mihama right under the big Ferris Wheel. You may also go by taxi, but it's quite expensive because it involves using the highway, which is why its recommended to use either the bus. We will give you further instructions about transportation to Chatan area once your booking is confirmed. We will promise you to make your trip unforgettable! Don't miss this chance!
strTitle: Rent a Go-Kart and ride around Chatan, Okinawa!

strIntroduction: This activity will take you to the highest bungee jump in Japan. (100 meters high). It takes half day for the trip and the bungee jump. The location is the valley of Ibaraki prefecture's Hitachiohta city. In spring and autumn, you can enjoy watching the beautifully colored mountains. If you come from Tokyo, we will meet at Tsukuba Station in the morning (I can pick you up also from JR Tsuchiura Station or Ibaraki Airport). We will arrive at Ryujin-ootsurihashi Bridge by car in about 90 minutes. After the check-in, you will receive an explanation about protection tools from the instructor. When we arrive at the middle of the bridge, you will find the stairs leading to under the bridge. Go there and you will have a strange feeling like walking in the air. After the instructions it’s time to jump! As an option, you can get photos taken by a professional cameraman. Show off to your friends with the photos! You can enjoy shopping at a local shopping center Michino-eki or a service area on the highway on the way back.
strTitle: Challenge yourself with the highest bungee jump in Japan!

strIntroduction: After the great fire of 1872, the Meiji Imperial government seized the opportunity to demonstrate Japan’s aspirations to join Western civilization. The special attention of people towards this area was never lost even after experiencing another devastation in the Great Kanto earthquake in 1923 as well as from the Tokyo air raids in 1945. So then when did the area develop as the premier site for consumption, fashion, chic and elegance? The architecture definitely helped to create the unique character of Ginza passing down its history to the future generation. It’s usually not visible but our experienced guide will take pleasure in showing you. The tour starts from Tsukiji Hongwan-ji temple located adjacent to Tsukiji station. It’s a very uniquely designed temple of the Jodo Shinshu sect (the True Pure Land Sect of Buddhism) by Chuta Itoh, a prominent architect and architectural theorist of the early twentieth-century who incorporated various architectural influences from all over the world. The next site is the eye-catching Kabukiza theater building inheriting the traditional style from the past generations and newly reconstructed by Kengo Kuma in 2013. Then, we move on to the outstanding Kisho Kurokawa’s Nakagin Capsule tower from the Metabolism movement. We then continue on to the Ginza’s main boulevard which is uniquely designed to keep an elegant air and we will take a secret side trip to see the backstreet neighborhood to appreciate the different aspects of the area and observe eye-catching buildings designed by another world-famous architects including Shigeru Ban’s Nicolas G. Hayek Center and Renzo Piano’s Maison Hermes before finally finishing up at the intersection of Ginza 4-chome where the prominent Wako Hattori (Seiko) clock tower building has been ticking away the history of Ginza’s prosperity. Duration 3 hours - Morning tour starts at 10:00am and ends at 13:00pm - Afternoon tour starts at from 13:00 pm and ends at 16:00pm
strTitle: Join a Unique Ginza Architecture Tour

strIntroduction: Known as the Golden Route, this classic tour showcases the best of Japan. From its modern and technologically advanced metropolis to the cultural hotpots of its ancient cities. A wide-range of activities are available for your enjoyment. With a professional English-speaking local guide accompanying you in your journey, you will be assured of a memorable and worry-free Japan holiday. The 7-day tour itinerary for this package is as follows: Day 1: Arrival From either Narita or Haneda International Airport, our shared shuttle service personnel shall be waiting for you at the arrival area. Board our shuttle which shall transfer you to your hotel in Tokyo. (Please check booking options for the list of hotels) Day 2: Tokyo Private Walking Tour Our English-speaking guide shall pick you up from your hotel. Together, you shall travel around and explore Tokyo using its fast and convenient metro system. You shall first visit the historic district of Asakusa. See the famous Kanon Temple and Kaminarimon Gate. Then, proceed to Imperial Palace East Gardens, the only part of the Palace open to tourists. Have a walking tour around Marunouchi and Ginza, often considered as Tokyo's Manhattan. Visit Meiji Jingu, one of the most important shrine's in Japan and a serene space in the bustling metropolis. Stroll around Harajuku, Japan's center of youth fashion. End the tour on top of Metropolitan Government Office were an observatory let's you see one of the best panorama of Tokyo's skyline. (For this tour, we shall provide you with a one-day city metro pass which you can use even after your guided tour) Day 3: Kamakura Walking Tour Meet your guide in the morning at your hotel's lobby. Accompanied by your guide, take a 60-minute train ride to Kamakura, one of Japan's ancient capital. Visit the famous Tsurugaoka Hachimangu Shrine an important place of worship for the Shinto faith. Visit the best 3 temples in Kamakura: 1) Hokokuji, known for its pristine bamboo garden, 2) Hasedera, the magestic temple of Kanon and 3) Kotokuin, home of the Giant Buddha. Take some time to stroll around at Komachi-dori for shop for souvenirs and local goods. After the tour, your guide shall bring you back to Tokyo. Day 4: Fuji-Hakone Tour Wake-up early in the morning to prepare for check-out. Drop your luggage at the service counter of your hotel and it shall be delivered directly to your next hotel in Kyoto the same day. At 7:45am your guide shall arrive to pick you up. Together, you shall ride the express train to Hakone. You shall see picture-perfect views of Mount Fuji while riding one of the world's longest series of ropeways. Stop-by Owakudani Valley and have a short stroll around a number of steam dents and bubbling pools. Next, experience a scenic cruise in Lake Ashi. After the tour, the guide shall bring you to Odawara Station where you need to board a bullet train to reach Kyoto. Once in Kyoto, you shall be welcomed by one of our local guides and escorted to your hotel which is just a few minutes walk from the station. Day 5: Kyoto Walking Tour Meet your guide at the hotel's lobby. Start your tour early to be able to beat the crowds that is a usual sight in this city. First, visit Kinkakuji, the famed Golden Temple. Proceed to Higashiyama where visitors can still witness the splendors of this ancient city that were miraculously preserved. Visit Kiyomizudera, a temple famous for its spring and autumn views. Stroll around Ninenzaka and Sannenzaka, where streets are lined up with traditional houses and shops. Have a walking tour around Gion, Kyoto's entertainment district, where you might spot a geisha, and visit Nishiki Market, known as "Kyoto's Kitchen," once you get your fill of Kyoto's cultural sights, your guide shall bring you back to your hotel. (For this tour, we shall provide you with a one-day city bus pass which you can use even after your guided tour) Day 6: Uji and Fushimi Excursion Meet your guide at your hotel and proceed to Uji by commuter train. Visit the famous Byodoin temple and stroll around the town's traditional shopping street to sample its local goods. Visit Taihoan, a traditional tea house and take part of an authentic tea ceremony. Next, proceed to Fushimi Inari Taisha. One of the highlights of your visit to Japan is climbing this shrine filled of thousands of red gates called "torii." At the top, a scenic view of Kyoto awaits. Ride the train back to Kyoto with your guide and return to your hotel. Day 7: Departure After your preparations, check-out from your hotel. At your preferred time, our shared shuttle service shall pick you up and transport you to Kansai International Airport for your departure from Japan to your next destination. *** IMPORTANT INFORMATION *** 1) All tours are walking tours utilizing Japan's efficient public transportation. There are certain parts of the tour in which guests have to walk for a considerable length. We recommend you to wear comfortable walking shoes and check with us if you have certain ailments. 2) This package tour is strictly subject to availability. We may not be able to offer the experience even on days marked available if our preferred hotels become suddenly booked, or other unforeseen circumstances. For these instances, your payment shall be fully refunded. 3) Booking must be made two (2) weeks prior to the tour 4) This tour package is not available on the following dates: April 29 to May 8, 2016; August 12 to 15, 2016; and December 29, 2016 to January 2, 2017 5) For children ages 11 years old and under, a child price may be available. Please inquire with us for further details.
strTitle: Embark on a 7-day Golden Route Holiday in Japan

Note: The price does not include lunch. Please be prepared to take care of your own lunch during the 150 minutes of free time at Tropical Dream Center. Meeting times and places: 1）Pallette Kumoji in front of Nippon Rent-A-Car 8:20 am 2）T Galleria near the GEO: 8:50 am Time required: 10 hours Disclaimer: 1. The order of the tour destinations could be changed due to traffic conditions on the day. 2. It is possible make a reservation at 22:00 pm the day before the tour day. 3. The price does not include lunch. Please be prepared to take care of your own lunch during the 150 minutes of free time at Tropical Dream Center. 4. The bus guide will introduce you all the thing. 5. strIntroduction: In this tour in Osaka, I will take you to more pleasant places than any other guide! See the amazing Shinkansen bullet train passing in front of you and try delicious Japanese tempura! The itinerary as follows. ●A Half Day Tour ① Meet at Osaka (Umeda) train station at 2:00 PM. Travel on Hankyu Railway to Kammaki Station, Osaka. Then we will watch the high-speed passing Shinkansen for about an hour or so from the station right in front of us. This is a great opportunity to make photos of the bullet train. ② Depart from Kammaki rail station at 4:00 PM. for Namba, Osaka. Dinner in Daikichi. *Daikichi is one of the most famous tempura restaurants in Osaka. ③ We'll end the tour at 8:00 PM. Let's enjoy Osaka together!
strTitle: See the high-speed Shinkansen and eat Tempura in Osaka

strIntroduction: Known as the Golden Route, this classic tour showcases the best of Japan. From its modern and technologically advanced metropolis to the cultural hotpots of its ancient cities. A wide-range of activities are available for your enjoyment. With a professional English-speaking local guide accompanying you in your journey, you will be assured of a memorable and worry-free Japan holiday. The 6-day tour itinerary for this package is as follows: Day 1: Pick-up from Narita or Haneda Airport and transfer to hotel (must be within downtown Tokyo) Day 2: Tokyo Private Walking Tour (09:00 - 16:00) - Pick-up at hotel (must be within downtown Tokyo) - Explore Tsukiji Fish Market and check out today’s fresh catch (on days that the market is closed, the tour will introduce Tokyo's Imperial Palace) - Discover old temples and traditional shopping districts in Asakusa - Take a scenic cruise along Sumida river - Visit Ryogoku’s sumo stadium and its surrounding museums Day 3: Fuji Hakone Tour/Transfer to Osaka (07:40 - 18:40) - Pick-up at hotel (must be within downtown Tokyo) - Ride an express train to reach Hakone - See picture-perfect views of Mount Fuji while riding one of the world's longest series of ropeways - Experience a scenic boat cruise at Lake Ashi - Stopover at the tranquil Hakone Shrine - Ride a bullet train from Odawara to Osaka Day 4: Osaka Walking Tour - Pick-up at hotel (must be within downtown Osaka) - visit Osaka Castle, Osaka's main tourist attraction - walking tour of Shinsekai, Osaka's prewar entertainment district - stroll around Dotombori and Shinsaibashi, shopping and food tour Day 5: Kyoto Private Walking Tour (09:00 - 17:00) - Pick-up at Hotel (must be within downtown Osaka) - ride a rapid train from Osaka to Kyoto - Visit Kinkakuji Temple, this famed golden temple is seen often in covers of numerous travel magazines and promotions. - Proceed to Kiyomizudera Temple. The street that leads towards the temple is lined up with restaurants and stores selling souvenirs. - Walking tour to Yasaka Shrine and Gion passing by old streets and temples at Higashiyama District. Day 6: Pick-up from hotel and transfer to Kansai International Airport *This pick-up can be made at a later day What this tour includes: - round-trip airport transfers - private English-speaking guides - entrance fees to attractions included in the tour - One-way express train fare from Shinjuku Station to Odawara Station (for Hakone) - Hakone free pass (Includes access to all transportation in Hakone Area) - One-way Shinkansen Tickets from Odawara Station to Shin-Osaka Station (Designated Seats) - Round-trip train tickets from Osaka to Kyoto (rapid train) *** IMPORTANT INFORMATION *** 1) Accommodation can be booked as an add-on option (proceed to booking page for details) 2) Booking must be made two (2) weeks prior to the tour 3) This tour package is not available on the following dates: April 29 to May 8, 2016; August 12 to 15, 2016; and December 29, 2016 to January 2, 2017
strTitle: Japan Tour Package Deal! Tokyo to Osaka in a 6-day holiday

strIntroduction: Miho Museum is a secret gem nestled in the green hills of Shiga prefecture. It was designed by the renowned architect, I. M. Pei, and is named after Koyama Mihoko, one of the richest women in Japan and the founder of the museum. The Museum's design and how it's integrated into the natural surroundings are some of its most interesting aspects, but you can also see a magnificent collection of works from ancient civilizations including the Egyptians, Romans, Japan and various Asian cultures, with the pieces largely coming from Koyama's private collection. You will be guided by a professional archaeologist, who speaks 8 languages and will explain to you the art works exhibited in the Museum. 09:00 Please go to Miho Museum on your own by public transportation or taxi (about 1 hour from Kyoto). We will give you instructions for transfer to the museum. 10:30 Your guide will meet you near Miho Museum's ticket office with "Fuji Travel" sign. 10:30 - 13:00 Excursion in Miho Museum guided by a professional archaeologist. 13:00 End of tour. Please go back to your hotel by your own. We recommend you to have lunch inside. Miho Museum's fine restaurant and tea room offer the genuine flavor of food prepared from ingredients grown by the Natural Agriculture method.
strTitle: Book a unique Miho Museum tour with an archaeologist, Shiga

strIntroduction: Enjoy local experiences in Narita area of Chiba prefecture! Following a pick up at JR Narita Station, JR Kashiwa Station, JR Matsudo Sttion, or Hokuso Line Keisei Narita Sky Access Line Shin-Kamagaya Station, we will embark on an interesting tour to the north of Chiba prefecture. You will drive to an orchard, a traditional temple, eat Japanese rice, walk around shopping streets and shop at a popular outlet. In the family-oriented rural orchard, you will see many flowers, crops, sakura cherry blossoms in spring, sunflowers in summer, cosmos flowers in autumn, poppies in winter. The field area is around 7000 m2. The Naritasan Shinshoji, with its age of more than 1000 years, is the oldest traditional Japanese temple in Chiba prefecture. Here you can draw a fortune stick, and also there are fortune teller shops around the temple. There are many Japanese style shops which sell omiyage (souvenirs) like Tsukemono (pickled food) and unagi cuisine (a Japanese eel set) along the street heading to Shinshoji Temple. You can see the cooking process in front of you. The food looks fresh and delicious! Finally, enjoy shopping at a reasonable price in Shisui outlet before ending the tour.
strTitle: Experience Chiba prefecture like a local on a day tour!

strIntroduction: Arashiyama is a pleasant, touristy district on the western outskirts of Kyoto. It's very easy to find. Get off the train at Arashiyama Station or Saga-Arashiyama Station and walk about 15 minutes, you will see the ticket office just along the river. The starting place, the Togetsukyo Bridge, is the most iconic landmark of Arashiyama. The bridge looks particularly attractive with the mountainside in the background. If you come and visit Japan during early April or November, you will see Arashiyama at its most beautiful. When the cherry blossoms fall, the river is just like pink silk across Kyoto. And when the fall comes, one of the most famous scenes in Japan will give you the most unforgettable experiences. It is also breathtaking in summer and winter. There are a bunch of festivals during summertime and a great snowy view in the winter. There are four options for you. All of them need to reserved in advance. Plan A : One boat for five people maximum This plan is the most reasonable plan for a family tour or some friends who just want to enjoy themselves. No food included. The boating time is around one hour between 11:00 and 16:00. Plan B : A traditional style boat with meal reserved You can enjoy the very Japanese style lunch along the beautiful river. Experience the exact same thing like the ancient people. The boating time is around one hour between 11:00 and 16:00. Plan C : Playing with cormorants (a type of aquatic bird) while boating for ten people maximum Get to know how ancient Japanese people living with cormorants and observe cormorants' habits. Only from July 1st to Sep 23rd *The boating time is around 2 hours from 19:00 to 21:00. Plan D : Playing with cormorants while boating with meal reserved. Similar to Plan C plus enjoy the dinner on the river. . Only groups of 10 or more booking in advance. *The boating time is around 2 hours. 7/1~8/31: Depart at 19:00~21:00 9/1~9/23: Depart at 18:30~20:30 (except 8/16).
strTitle: Ride on Private Boats in Arashiyama, Kyoto!

strIntroduction: Whether you want to practice for real outdoor climbing, enjoy climbing, like exercise or are just looking to try a new activity, come and have a day of fun climbing at this facility. Here you can challenge yourself at any level from beginner to advanced by yourself or with a group of friends. It's guaranteed to be an unforgettable experience. Climbing shoes are available to rent at 200 JPY per pair. Please prepare, socks, comfortable clothes, a towel and a drink. If this is your first visit to the facility, a registration fee of 500 JPY is required. Children 6 years old and above can participate in this activity. But please note that elementary school children may join until 18:00 on weekdays and until 15:00 on weekends or holidays. They must be accompanied by a parent or guardian. From 20:00, children in middle school and below must be accompanied by a parent or guardian.
strTitle: Enjoy Climbing and Bouldering in Tokyo!

strIntroduction: Make your magical dreams come true and shoot your wedding photos in Kobe! The photo studio "Ange aile" opened 50 years ago and has been providing quality and breathtaking photos since then. The professional photographers and makeup artists do their best to make your special day an unforgettable experience. The studio shooting will be held at a chapel in Ange aile Nishi-Kobe studio, and the location shooting will be at Akashi Park. On the day of the photoshoot, you may come in your casual clothes and don't have to bring anything. You will first meet with the consultant and discuss your shoot. Don't hesitate to say explain exactly what you want. The staff will organize the best album for you! Next, you will choose which dresses, hairstyle, and accessories you like. For this activity, you may wear both a Western wedding dress and a Japanese kimono. Then, time for you close up! The professional photographer will make you relaxed and draw out your best smile. After that, you will select the best photos from all of your cuts for your album. There are several plans for the designs of the album, so you can select the best one for you. 2-3 weeks later, your wedding album will be sent to your home! About Akashi Park: Akashi Park is a historical park and Akashi Castle used to be. It is well-known as one of the best spots in Japan to see cherry blossoms in spring. The greenery of this park is very beautiful and is a great backdrop for breathtaking photos! Why don't you make an unforgettable memory with your wedding photoshoot in Kobe? This tour is available everyday except for Tuesdays. Operating Hours: Monday, Wednesday-Friday: 10:00 - 19:00 Saturday-Sunday, national holidays: 9:00 - 19:00
strTitle: Enjoy a Studio Wedding Photoshoot at Akashi Park in Kobe!

strIntroduction: What better way to make your trip in Japan truly memorable than to swim with dolphins on Miyakejima Island in Tokyo! Miyakejima is a volcanic island in Tokyo that is accessible by ferry or plane. Whether your a city dweller or an island lover, this is the perfect trip for you! Both ferries and flights to the island are available every day. When you arrive at Miyakejima you will swim with Indo-Pacific bottlenose dolphins in tropical waters on a special course. Join the dolphins along the coral reefs in the blue waters. It would be a special and unique experience for you while you are in Tokyo! *Please note that this tour is only for licensed scuba divers with previous diving experience. Schedule: Morning course: - 07:00 Check-in at Miyakejima Snapper or pick up from the port - Check-in Once you arrive, sign in and get ready for the day. - Safety Lecture We will give you an explanation on the important points of the day and the basics of diving. - Dolphin Swim Join the beautiful and elegant dolphins in the water and watch as they gracefully swim and play. - 11:00 Check-out at Miyakejima Snapper or drop off at the port Afternoon course - Same as above. Meeting time is 13:00 and checkout time is 17:00. Directions By car: - About 20 minutes from Miyakejima Airport and Miyakejima Port via Todo 212 - About a 5 minute walk from the Minowa bus stop of the municipal bus *We have a parking area for about 10 vehicles. We can pick you up and drop you off at the port. Please let us know the time of reservation and if you need our transportation service. *For transportation to and from the airport, please consult us, as we can not offer this at all times.
strTitle: Swim with Dolphins on Miyakejima Island!

strIntroduction: The host will pick you up from a train station nearby Yanagawa city around 30 minutes before the lesson. No need to wear a karate uniform, just wear easy to move pants and a T-shirt. Then instructor does not speak English well, but he will welcome you to the class and teach you the karate techniques. After the class you will be dropped off at the same train station. Pick-up from a hotel in Yanagawa is also possible.
strTitle: Discover Karate in a 60 minute lesson near Yanagawa, Fukuoka

strIntroduction: Walking through Omotesando gives you a feel of what Tokyo life is about. This place has a lot of charm and creativity. The buildings that we see stand out as architectural gems on a street known for its style. You'll get to see what separates good design from average design. The walk is organized around a central theme by your host in order to spark conversation within the small group. Bring your walking shoes, because this walk does cover a good distance. There's a chance to get coffee at one of the trendy new coffee shops in Tokyo. On this walk you'll see several new buildings that are changing the role that architecture plays in society. Highlights include the Gyre building, Dior and Omotesando Hills. You'll get to wind through the small streets of Tokyo. Really these streets are the heart of the city. You can choose between a walk starting at 10 am or 3 pm. The 3 pm walk is a busier time than the 10 am walk. If you're a people watcher, choose the 3 pm slot. Groups are small, no more than six guests in order to give the best experience for the guests.
strTitle: Experience Omotesando's architecture on a guided tour

strIntroduction: Discover the central west of Hokkaido from Otaru to Niseko. This tour gives you an opportunity to see, experience, eat, and touch the real local life of Otaru and Niseko areas. There are many interesting spots around Otaru and Niseko. Therefore I want to make sure that my tour satisfies your wishes. I will introduce several spots when we meet up at Otaru Station and I will make a customized tour for you. Otaru canal is one of the major spots in Otaru. Usually it's a bit crowed but still worth to walk around and take some pictures. We will eat a small snack around here. Suitengu（水天宮）Otaru is also nice area to walk around. Suitengu is a shrine with nice views of Otaru port and the downtown. There are many nice cafes and shops around here. If the weather is nice, I want to take you to Otaru Aquarium to see the life of Hokkaido's beautiful sea. After Otaru I will take you to Yoichi town by car. The famous Yoichi whiskey factory is a must see! We will drive the nice scenic highway toward Niseko. Along the way, you can enjoy the scenic views of mountains and nature. We will stop by Kyogoku water park to get mineral water from Mt. Yotei. Then we will visit some cafes, cheese shops, ice cream shops, and an organic vegetable market. You will stay at Cottage Bongo in Niseko. Bongo offers a really nice private log house for you to stay. You can buy some vegetables and seafood around Niseko, then have a BBQ at Cottage Bongo for your own dinner. I can take you to a nearby onsen (hot spring) after dinner. If you want, you can drink some local beer and wine after the onsen.
strTitle: Discover Otaru and Niseko on a tour with overnight stay

strIntroduction: For this 2 hours tour, please check the following example timetable: (the starting time can be decided by you, only the necessary time for each part of the tour is mentioned below) 00:00 Meet up at "Omotesando exit" of JR Harajuku station. 00:00~00:30 Go to Meiji-Jingu Shrine, learn a bit about history of Japan, shinto religion's gods, events, how to pray and what kind of spirit there are. 00:30~01:20 Go to Takeshita street and look around some shops and people there, such as "kawaii things or kawaii girls". Take a rest at a Harajuku-styled cafe. 01:20~01:50 See the Omotesando street. Look at famous shops and famous architecture. Omotesando is one of the places which creates new trends to all of japan. 1st outlet of foreign restaurants sometimes opened around this area. 02:00 (apx.) End of tour and guide you to a shop, restaurant or a station of your choice. Part of the schedule might be changed depending on the day.
strTitle: Explore Harajuku and Omotesando in a 2-hour tour

strIntroduction: You can experience the art of flower decoration which mixes the Western and Japanese styles in a beautiful way. The venue, the Russian church gallery, is also very beautiful. You can enjoy the flower experience and the atmosphere of the unusual old Russian church in Kyoto! The lesson starts with an easy decoration so don't worry if you do not have any prior experience. The flowers decoration experience takes about 1 hour and 30 minutes. The materials are prepared for you (flowers, vase and other materials) We will provide seasonal flowers for this experience.
strTitle: Flower Decoration Lesson in a Russian church gallery, Kyoto

strIntroduction: This tour is for 1 to 3 people. I will take you around the Niseko mountains. There are many mountains that are fairly easy to walk around. Here you can refresh your mind and body. I will pick you up from your accommodation in the morning. Then I will take you to the mountains depending on your request. We will have lunch at the top of mountain so we will buy some food on the way. Depending on season, the tour contents will change. During spring it is fun to walk around and see bits of snow left from the winter. During summer, it is full of green and life. During fall, it is nice to see colored leaves. After the hiking, I will take you to an onsen (hot spring). There are many onsen springs around Niseko. It is good to relax your body at a hot spring after the hiking. If you choose the one night stay plan, I can organize BBQ at the accommodation. You will stay at a nice log house cottage. If you want to take this plan, you need to come as a group of 2 or 3 people. Since the style is private cottage, it is better to stay there as a group. The cottage has kitchen, usual cooking utensils, dishes, dining space, loft floor to sleep, toilet, TV, free Wi-Fi. Then the next day, we will explore other mountain or lakes.
strTitle: Enjoy Hokkaido's nature by hiking Niseko's mountains

strIntroduction: This is a forest therapy tour by tractor where visitors can see the historical Koiwai Farm in Iwate prefecture. Explore and relax in the greenery of green paradise! Koiwai Farm was opened in 1891 and is one of the most historical dairy products maker in Japan. They offer this tour to show and tell the guests how exciting the “dairy farming, forestry, service” are. The total farm space is approx. 3000 ha, which is twice as big as Haneda Airport. Koiwai Farm has been working continuously on forestry. They’ve been taking care of each afforestation for more than 100 years and are handing the practice down to the younger generation. In this tour, you can ride on the tractor bus and explore the impressive and relaxing atmosphere of this forest. There will be a tour guide who works at the farm and the guide will tell us stories about the animals living in the forest. Since this forest in Koiwai Farm has an original ecosystem, you may be able to see some endangered species and rare biodiversity. The scenery of the forest will change every season, so you will never get the same tour twice. We recommend this tour to guests who are interested in attending academic tours such as visiting museums or guests who love to take photos! There are many photo shooting spots to enjoy the seasonal scenery of Koiwai Farm. Also, great for those who enjoy relaxing the great outdoors! Join this exciting nature tour where you can not only see the impressive view of grassland but also visit the forest that has more than 100 years of history! This tour is available during April 15th to November 6th. Itinerary: Meet your guide in front of the tractor station at Makibaen in Koiwai Farm ※You have 5 options for the meeting time. 10:00 / 11:00 / 14:00 / 15:00 13:00 (Only on Saturdays, Sundays, national holidays) This tour ends at the point of departure.
strTitle: Enjoy Wonderful Nature with Tractor Bus Tour in Iwate!

strIntroduction: In this activity organized by “Classical Princess Japon”, you can try on a Classic Kimono Dress and feel yourself transform into a gorgeous and elegant princess. You can truly see your beauty and grace personified in the photos. Classical Princess Japon focuses on bustle dresses (classical dresses) from the Meiji Era and successfully created their own original bustle dresses made of antique kimono fabrics. Their mission is to help guests explore the fusion of Japanese and foreign culture. You are able to select one of three places for your photoshoot. Firstly, The Osaragi Jiro Memorial Museum. Osaragi Jiro(1897-1973) was a novelist born in Yokohama, Kanagawa, and in this memorial museum you can see his products and many other historical documents. It is located near the park where you can see the Yokohama port The arch-shaped roof with the exterior of red brick is very outstanding. Secondly, Yokohama Red Brick Warehouse No.1. It is one of the most popular tourist spots in Yokohama, which is a cultural and commercial facility that utilizes two historical buildings constructed more than a century ago. The building contains cafes, restaurants, and shops. Seasonal events are often held there. Thirdly, Buildings of Yamate-Seiyokan. Yamate-Seiyokan. There are 7 western-style buildings that have a long history. This tour is available everyday.
strTitle: Wear a Traditional Kimono and Do a Photoshoot in Kanagawa!

strIntroduction: This is a fascinating nature tour in the Ogasawara Islands, Tokyo where a guide will take you to the sea to meet whales. The Ogasawara Islands are a part of Tokyo and a World Nature heritage location and this tour will be held around one of the Islands called Chichijima, which is a 25 hours ferry trip from Tokyo. Unfortunately the ferry only runs once a week, but it is well worth visiting this place if you are a great fan of nature. Whale Watching Humpback whales and Sperm whales raise and nurture their young in the waters of the Ogasawara Islands giving you a great chance to get close to these magnificent mammals. See them breach, spout, tail slap and play. The tour schedule is as below and you can choose from morning or afternoon. A. Morning plan 8:15- 12:00 08:15-08:30 Meet up at Experience Meeting Point or Pick-up from your accommodation in Chichijima B. Afternoon plan 11:45- 15:00 11:45-12:00 Meet up at Experience Meeting Point or Pick-up from your accommodation in Chichijima About Pick-up Service If your accommodation is located further than Sakaiura, your pick up time will be 15 minutes earlier. Pick-up: You can choose either Pick-up or Check-in (free). Optional: Rental snorkeling gear + 1,000 JPY Mask, snorkel and fins Rental wetsuit + 1,000 JPY Prescription goggles + 500 JPY Fins only + 500 JPY
strTitle: Enjoy Half Day Whale Watching in the Sea of Ogasawara

strIntroduction: The Ogasawara Islands are located in the North-Western Pacific Ocean roughly 1,000 km south of Tokyo and have a rare variety of plants and animals including more than 440 species of native vascular plants. They are also the habitat for more than 100 recorded native land snail species. The islands were formed by the protrusions of an ancient underwater volcano. Chichijima (Chichi Island) in the Ogasawara archipelago is regarded as the main Island and the entrance to the Ogasawara Islands area. It will take about 25 hours from Tokyo Bay by regular passenger ship which operates once in 6 days during the winter and once in 3 days in the peak season. There are world-class of diving spots in Ogasawara Islands and most of the snorkeling spots are in clear blue water allowing for viewing the colorful coral leafs and a dynamic variety of fish. On this snorkeling tour there will be a lot of points that will excite you, such as the experience of floating in the sea, chasing beautiful fish, seeing a sunken ship and more. Wearing only snorkeling gear, you can have a great experience in the undersea world of the Ogasawara Islands with an experienced instructors's guidance. If it is your first time to try snorkeling the professional instructor will give you a beginner's lesson so you don't need to worry! Schedule: -Morning course: 08:00- 08:30 Meet at Take Nature Academy or Pick-up from your accommodation in Chichijima 08:30 Check in for the tour at Take Nature Academy Snorkeling for around 2 - 3 hours 12:00 Check out from the tour at Take Nature Academy -Afternoon course: 11:30- 12:00 Meet at Take Nature Academy or Pick-up from your accommodation in Chichijima 12:00 Check in for the tour at Take Nature Academy Snorkeling for around 2 - 3 hours 15:30 Check out from the tour at Take Nature Academy
strTitle: Enjoy Wonderful Snorkeling in the Ogasawara Islands!

strIntroduction: This activity is held in the rural south part of Fukuoka prefecture, about 45-60 minutes by train from Fukuoka city. I will pick you up from the train station or the bus stop: JR Hainuzuka Station, Nishitetu Hatchomuta Station, or the bus stops with the same name. The cost of the pick-up and transportation to the venue is included in the tour fee. If you want me to pick you up from JR Saga Station (Saga city), you will need additional 2000 JPY for one way trip. We will go to the studio, fully sound proof cement building, and start basic skill practicing with the instructor. After practice, other local students will come and join to show their drum skills. After the group practice, the instructor will performa a solo or a group mini show. Finally, there will be a short break and you can watch how locals practice in the advance course. After the activity ends, I will drop you off to the same train station or bus stop.
strTitle: Discover traditional Japanese drum with a mini show, Fukuoka

strIntroduction: In this tour, we will drive into the Zen meditation world for an hour. Contents of this tour: 1. Study the history of Zen meditation, about 10 minutes. 2. How to do Zen meditation, about 5 minutes. 3. Experience Zen meditation, up to 40 minutes. === Note === 1. Contact me in advance This tour will be held at a real zen temple, and most temples do not offer Zen meditation every day. So, I have to confirm how many people your group has first. After that I'll confirm the Zen temple that can accept the tour. Contact me a week prior to the tour. 2. About small children This tour requires silence because of Zen meditation characteristics. If your children cannot keep quiet, I cannot accept this tour. Please tell me if you have small children.
strTitle: Practice Zen meditation at a Zen temple in Inzai, Chiba

strIntroduction: In this tour, we will drive into the Japanese rural world for an hour. Contents of this tour: 1. Study feature of this area's village-vicinity mountain, about 5 minutes. 2. Let's run/walk around the nearby mountains and hills, about 40 minutes. === Note === 1. Guiding In this tour we will study really simple features of village-vicinity mountains at first. But PLEASE NOTE this: this tour is not historical. The main contents of this tour is activity-based: feeling Inzai city's rural cozy wind by running/walking. 2. Clothes Please bring a change of clothes or towel. Please come with casual clothes which you would not mind getting dirty.
strTitle: Inzai's Rural Village Vicinity Mountain Running/Walking Tour

strIntroduction: Minamijima (Minami Island ) is an uninhabited Island located about one kilometer southwest of Chichijima island, the largest island in the Ogasawara archipelago. The only way to reach the Ogasawara islands is by taking a 25 hours and a half long ferry ride from Tokyo covering a distance of over 1,000 kilometers. It takes approx. 20 mins by boat from Chichijima island's Futami Harbor to Minami Island and 1.5 hours by sea kayak from Kominato Coast. Minami Island has a submerged karst terrain and is a geologically valuable Island, surrounded by a beautiful white sand beach and rocky cliffs. The white sand beach is covered with snail shell fossils, which give it a very charming atmosphere. In Minami Island, there are many indigenous animals and plants such as the Coenobita crab, an endangered species. From May to September, during the spawning season of the green sea turtle, it is possible to see the baby turtles after they hatch from their eggs. Minami Island is home to a variety of sea birds as well, so you might be able to spot chicks around June and empty nests on the ground. To protect Minami island's ecosystem, only 100 visitors are allowed to enter each day for a maximum of two hours and accompanied by a licensed local guide. The visit of the island involves some climbing through rocky terrain, however, the stunning view that will be awaiting you at the top will surely become an unforgettable memory. The Morning tour will pick you up at 8:15 at your accommodation in Chichijima island and depart at 8:30 from Take Nature Academy, finishing at 11:30; while the afternoon tour will pick you up at 12:45 at your accommodation and depart at 13:00 from Take Nature Academy, returning at 16:00.
strTitle: Visit the beautiful Minami Island in the Ogasawara Islands!

strIntroduction: In this tour you can stay at a gorgeous tent and enjoy the beautiful nature at the same time! You won't believe it's a tent! It features beds, a sofa, a table and even electric power. It's a new style of outdoor leisure, known as glamping. The idea is to relax under the beautiful stars and enjoy nature in a comfortable way. By staying at Twin Ring Motegi, you'll discover a new side of nature. You'll get to know many kinds of creatures and plants in the forest around you and experience the change of seasons. Among the many attractions, there's a 561 meter long "Zip Line" that will let you soar above the forest. It is so much fun that not only children but also adults will enjoy this attraction to the fullest. This is one of the longest zip-lines in Japan. This tour also includes a delicious BBQ dinner. You'll be able to choose between steaks, Paella, burgers, etc. And in the morning, you can have breakfast at the hotel nearby. Twin Ring Motegi is located in Tochigi prefecture. From Tokyo it takes about 3 hours by train or bus. Take a train or Shinkansen (bullet train) to Utsunomiya Station, Mito Station or Motegi Station and change to a bus to reach Twin Ring Motegi.
strTitle: Go camping in style at Twin Ring Motegi in Tochigi

strIntroduction: This tour is available from May 1st ~ Nov 15th. This tour will take you to see the world-famous Snow Monkeys that reside in Jigokudani followed by a bicycle ride through the countryside. Your guide will meet you at Nagano Station at 8:45am. From Nagano Station, get taken to the Snow Monkey Park in Yudanaka. The region's snow monkeys are world-famous for their habit of soaking in hot springs during winter. These amazing macaques will let you get really close to them for some great photo opportunities. After saying goodbye to the snow monkeys, stroll along a forest trail to a nearby restaurant where you will enjoy lunch before heading off to the Japanese countryside and a historic hot spring town by bicycle. The route takes you mostly downhill through the Japanese countryside past rice paddies, apple orchards and rivers, as well as takes you to the old town of Shibu Onsen which has a history of over 1300 years with its hot springs. You will also have the chance to taste some local onsen town delicacies. You will learn about the history and culture of the region while riding your bike past rice paddies, orchards, and many more panoramic sights. The tour ends at Yudanaka Station where you can get the train back to Nagano Station or before getting on the train, take a relaxing foot bath for free! Tour itinerary: 08:45 Meet up at Nagano Station under the East Exit information board opposite of the Shinkansen exit. 10:00 Welcome to the Snow Monkey area! Walk for 30 minutes along a forest trail to the Snow Monkey Park where you get to enjoy the wild monkeys playing around. 12:15 Have delicious lunch nearby the Snow Monkey Park! 13:00 Leave the lunch restaurant and get ready to see the Japanese countryside on bicycle! 13:30 Start at the Snow Monkey Resorts Info & Gift Shop. 16:00 Arrive at the Yudanaka Station and get on the train back to Nagano. No need to cycle back up the hill. The train leaves from Yudanaka to Nagano Station at 16:43. (Finishing time may vary depending cycling speed, taking photos, etc.) 17:30 Arrival back to Nagano Station.
strTitle: Enjoy a one day Snow Monkey and Cycling Tour in Nagano

strIntroduction: Big sushi roll, "Futomaki", is a local specialty from Chiba. It's a treat during festivals and celebrations. It looks beautiful and tastes good. Learn how to make Futomaki sushi roll from a local dietitian who knows all about Japanese food and then eat a delicious Kaiseki meal. It takes about 1 and half hour of learning and an hour of meal time. For this experience, come to our restaurant in Chiba. It is about 5 minutes walk from JR Chiba Station. Kaiseki is traditional Japanese cuisine from the Edo period. Did you know that in Japan, we have not only 4, but 72 different seasons traditionally? We express the beauty of those seasons in our cuisine. Food is all organic, no additives are used. We think food makes your body healthier and we serve only good food for you. We also have Aikido experience, special kimono experience, sushi making experience, learning the manners of Kaiseki, and Japanese music instrument experience for you. Please, check them also from our profile. Thank you!
strTitle: Experience making a Big Sushi Roll and Kaiseki meal in Chiba

strIntroduction: Japan is one of the most earthquake prone countries in the world, but it might be difficult for tourists to imagine what you are supposed to do when an earthquake comes. This tour will help you learn how to survive when you face a giant earthquake. I will take you to the disaster museum and the shop in Ikebukuro to offer: <1> short animation movie to learn about the earthquake history in Japan <2> Fire fighting training (you will learn to use a fire extinguisher) and train escaping from smoke filled room <3> Experience a giant earthquake with an earthquake simulation machine <4> Visit a store to see latest disaster protection goods in Japan <5> My experience talking about Tohoku earthquake on March 11, 2011 Here is outline of this tour: ■When? 7days a week Starting time are 12:00 pm or 2:00 pm ■Where to meet up? Pick up at your hotel (Central of Tokyo only) or meet up at lobby of Hotel Metropolitan in Ikebukuro ■How long? 3.5 hours Looking forward to seeing you!
strTitle: Experience an Earthquake Survival Study Tour in Tokyo

strIntroduction: You will be met by a local tourist guide at Otaru Port and walk to downtown or at the lobby of your hotel. Downtown Otaru is laid out and is remarkably compact and walkable city, so that most of the tourist spots can be accessed on foot. When visiting one of the Herring Palaces, Otaru guest house or the observatory on Mt. Tengu, you are advised to take a city bus. The old Otaru Canal is one of the "musts" for visitors. There are stone warehouses on both sides of the picturesque canal. They are now turned into tourist facilities: restaurants, gift shops, museums, etc. Please enjoy strolling along the canal and have a relaxing time. Extra info: The city is close to Yoichi town, one of its neighboring communities well-known for its Nikka whiskey distillery, in which you can enjoy a tour in a beautiful distilling facility with Scottish atmosphere. Toward the end of tour you can even taste their products for free. Yoichi is also known as a fruit growing community, which offers cherry picking in summer and apple harvesting in autumn. You can visit it by city bus. Otaru can be visited from Sapporo city, the capital city of Hokkaido, by train in 30 minutes.
strTitle: Enjoy an Introduction Tour to Otaru, Hokkaido

strIntroduction: You can choose the game which you want to see out of the areas and teams listed below Areas: Osaka or Kyoto or Nagoya 1. Gamba Osaka Popular player is Usami Takashi who played in Bayern Munich 2. Cerezo Osaka Former team of Kagawa Shinji, Dortmund 3. Kyoto Sanga Former team of Pak Chi Song 4. Nagoya Grampus Former team of Keisuke Honda, AC Milan I will arrange the tickets for you and your accompany. We'll meet at the station which is near to your hotel or the stadium of the above teams. Then we will go to the stadium together. We'll have a stadium tour and buy some local goods. We'll eat the stadium special food. And before the game I'll briefly explain to you about the team and individual players. Furthermore, you will learn how to "cheer" during the game to root for the team. When the game starts, we will cheer with the core supporters in the audience. When we score a goal, we will high-touch and hug with local Japanese supporters. This will make you "united" with local Japanese people!
strTitle: Watch an exciting football game in Nagoya, Osaka or Kyoto!

strIntroduction: This is a cycling tour around the center of Tokyo by an electrical assist bike. It is comfortable and safe for women, children and elderly people. The remarkable point is that we provide you with a wearable video camera. After the tour, we will give you the videos. This would be a vivid memory of your trip to Japan. The tour concept is: 1. Enjoy the city area of Tokyo 2. Experience the nature of Tokyo 3. Get to know the local people's life of Tokyo. We will start from Shinjuku area, and go to Shinjuku Gyoen which is the largest park with lots of nature. At Shinjuku Gyoen we will have lunch. We will provide you with the lunch box, Japanese style, or sandwiches if you like. Before the tour, we will ask you if you prefer to eat at a restaurant. If so, we will take you to a meal set restaurant where local Japanese eat often. Then we will go to the east to Jingu Gaien area, where the Olympic Stadium is under construction. After that we will cycle around the Imperial Palace enjoying the nice news. We will pass the Marunouchi area. It is the center of business of Japan. Many famous companies have their offices there. In the Marunouchi area we will go to Masakado-zuka. It's the grave of Tairano Masakado who is thought to be the spiritual guardian of Tokyo according to some legends. Finally, we will visit Kanda area. It's an old area where you can enjoy the local culture of Tokyo. In total the tour will take 4 to 5 hours.
strTitle: Cycle around Tokyo with an electric bike and a camera

strIntroduction: We will hire a huge vehicle to carry the bikes, and will come to pick you up from your hotel in Nagoya. The car accommodates 6 bikes and 6 people maximum. We will reach Shinshiro city, where the beautiful Tanada (terraced rice fields) area is after an hour drive. It is included in the list of Japan's 100 Best terraced rice fields. We will go to top of the mountain, from where we bike down the slope and feel the wind! We will take pictures, of course. And we will give you a wearable camera. After the ride, we will download the video and send it to you as a memory from your trip. We will eat a lunch box during the tour, near the Tanada. On the way back to Nagoya, we will visit a hot spring (onsen). You can relax by soaking your body into the huge bathtub!
strTitle: One day cycling tour around terraced rice fields near Nagoya

strIntroduction: Takayama is one of the most popular places to visit in Japan. Many people visit Tokyo or Osaka, but Takayama is far away from those cities. The nearest terminal station where the Shinkansen bulle train stops is Nagoya Station. You will come to Nagoya by Shinkansen and we will come to pick you up from Nagoya Station. We will drive you to Takayama to see the natural scenic beauty of central Japan by a hired vehicle. After arriving at Takayama, we will tour around the city by walking, enjoying the traditional streets, temples, and shops. This will give you the feeling of exploring "little Kyoto". If you like, we can bring bikes with the vehicle. Then we will go to the mountain areas of Takayama and enjoy cycling with the bike down the hills. (Note: extra fee will apply for the bike rental) After enjoying Takayama, we will return back to Nagoya. On the way to Nagoya, we can visit a hot spring and relax. We can get to Nagoya Station by the evening. It will be possible for you to board a Shinkansen bullet train or go to your hotel.
strTitle: Walk or cycle around Takayama on a day tour from Nagoya

strIntroduction: In this reservation service, you will get an appointment in Nagoya, Aichi, and have the chance to experience a fashionable makeover of your nails! The latest art styles will decorate your fingers! Below is the itinerary of this activity: 1. Tell me your preferred date and time for this activity. The treatment takes about 3 hours for finger nails and toe nails. 2. I will make a reservation at a salon 3. I will pick you up wherever you like (within the center of Nagoya or your hotel). 4. You will have the chance to discuss and decide your nail designs with the nail designer. Don't worry, our staff will break the language barrier. 5. After the treatment, I can guide you to your next destination within the city. (Please note transportation expense will not be included.) ■Nail artist introduction (Nail artist: MEG) She presents creative designs in all aspects of fashion, including nails. She has been a pioneer in the Japanese nail industry, contributing to it since it started. Besides the management of one of the major nail salons in Japan, she is also a top nailist who has been responsible for the treatment of 200,000 customers. Furthermore, she concurrently serves as principal of a nailist school that has produced more than 2000 nailists. Besides appearing on a number of media such as TV and magazines, she has been receiving offers as a seminar lecturer from all over the world. ■Products I use No Damage products and all Japanese brands. Paragel is the latest nail technology that is created with the specific purpose of causing ZERO damage to your nails. No buffing is required so your nails can retain their 3 natural nail plates and therefore keep them healthy! This is compared to conventional gel nails which damage your natural nail due to buffing that damages the nail upon application and again upon removal! Unlike unconventional gel nails which will separate and discolor over time, Paragel retains its color! The LED light is used for only 30 seconds for quicker application! The Paragel itself is nail friendly and in fact acts as a fortifier to protect your nails. This is particularly recommended for ladies who paint their nails often. Please do not hesitate to ask me anything in advance!
strTitle: 60% OFF Visit a top nail salon in Nagoya, Aichi

strIntroduction: This course is about 2 hour long. Nail art is very popular in Japan. Both young and mature women enjoy gel nails. The number of people doing their own nails is increasing. The lecturer is a top manicurist with plenty of experience. You can pick a design from our design books to try for yourself. For more difficult art, our lecturer will be at hand to guide you along so that you can finish your design beautifully. All tools used are made in Japan. You can work with confidence using our quality products that do not damage the nail. We have also prepared our peel off base so that you can remove your nail art easily on your own. Details of the activity: 1. Please let us know your preferred date and timing. 2. On the day of the lesson, we will pick you up from your hotel (within Nagoya city). For those coming from outside of Nagoya we will pick you up from Nagoya Station. 3. Lesson will commence as soon as you arrive. All tools will be provided. 4. Our very experienced and professional nail lecturer will be at hand to help you out with difficult techniques.
strTitle: Enjoy learning nail technique in Nagoya, Aichi
