strIntroduction: I will teach you Japanese with a conversation book. If you are a beginner, we will try to say greetings and small talk, then write your name or something else in Hiragana, Katakana or Kanji. If you want, the lesson will be focused on conversation only. At first, I will pick you up from your hotel (or Haneda airport is also ok. I will bring you from the airpot to the hotel you booked, then after check-in we will start lesson. However, additional fees apply for airport pick-up.) One lesson lasts 2 hours including picking time and going to the cafe. This lesson fee and all optional fee are per person. I will arrange the lesson depending on your interests, so if there is something you want to learn, don't hesitate to share with me please. *Optional* - pick up at Haneda airport and bring to your hotel (lesson time starts when we get to the hotel.) -lesson at a Japanese Izakaya bar (not at cafe) Lesson time is 3.5 hours including sending you off to the hotel. This Izakaya lesson is available only after 5 pm.
strTitle: Let's learn Japanese with coffee at a cafe in Tokyo!

strIntroduction: The workshop takes place inside a studio of professional drum players. We provide each participant with a happi (a Kimono jacket), which needs to be worn over a T-shirt. Because of this, participants are asked to bring a T-shirt to the class. We have changing rooms (one for men and the other for women) at the studio for your convenience. The workshop begins with a powerful performance of the wadaiko (traditional Japanese drum) by Koharu and her daughter Kinako. Koharu is a professional drummer with 20 years of experience and leads Izu Hakone Daiko Troupe. Following the lesson, Koharu and Kinako will provide you with a drum lesson. You will play a few different pieces of music, starting with a slow-tempo one that is easy to master. You need no experience with drums. Koharu and Kinako will take your hand and walk you through what to do. If you are looking to try more advanced-level songs, just ask the instructors, and they will be happy to show you how to play them. We want you to discover how exciting drumming can be. So, just bring your curiosity to the class and enjoy the feel of rush from drum beats. Following the drum session, you will have the chance to sit back and watch Kinako’s graceful Kimono dance (what’s called Nihon-buyo in Japanese, which is a traditional performance dance in the Kimono). Each workshop will basically have four participants in minimum. This means you will likely share a class with other international visitors on the day. However, please choose the booking option which corresponds to the size of your group. If you prefer a private lesson, just let us know, and we will be happy to arrange it with Koharu and Kinako. Please contact us for price information on private lessons.
strTitle: Japanese Drum Lesson & Kimono Dance Performance in Asakusa

strIntroduction: Enjoy jazz music performance with a glass of champagne or a healthy dinner only at COTTON CLUB at Marunouchi, Tokyo with special price! COTTON CLUB is originally from New York, and is the legendary venue that spawned such jazz legends as Duke Ellington, Cab Calloway, Lena Horne, and so many others. COTTON CLUB was a vibrant scene that saw celebrities and socialites gather nightly to enjoy cutting edge musical entertainment amid the backdrop of the prohibition of the 1920’s. The mission of COTTON CLUB Japan is to bring back a taste of the Golden Age of the original COTTON CLUB, and to recreate a social scene for adult fans. At COTTON CLUB Japan, you can enjoy many performances of visiting world-class artists regularly in an elegant, luxuriously appointed venue, topped off by a delicious menu of authentic cuisine. There are two courses available for this reservation service: 1. Music Charge (Non-reserved seats) + A glass of champagne 2. Music Charge (Non-reserved seats) + Healthy dinner course (Appetizers, fish dish, and desserts) Both of the course are available for 34 jazz performances, and you can book them at special price! Reservation is difficult to make, so we suggest you to use our reservation service for your convenience! Also, please tell us which jazz music performance that you would like to attend and we will try our best to reserve it for you!
strTitle: Enjoy Jazz Music with Champagne or Healthy Dinner in Tokyo!

strIntroduction: "Trampoland Tokyo" is a trampoline park located in Itabashi, Tokyo. Here you can release your stress and have fun jumping up and down on a huge trampoline with family and friends. As many theme parks these days are designed for children only, this is a place where adults, families and couples can all come out and have a great time. This theme park has become famous recently and has been featured in many magazines and on TV. First, participants take "Starter Lesson" to learn the basics of bouncing and how to conduct oneself on the trampoline. The instructor will teach you how to jump straight up, move your body in the air, and how to do a variety of drops. After the lesson, patrons are free to jump on the trampoline. Its 16m by 6m frame is large enough for everyone to enjoy the free space in their own style. Many past participants agreed that not only is it a lot of fun, but great training for our muscles. What a fun way to get a workout! Make sure to wear comfortable clothes so that you can fully enjoy the activity. Don’t miss this opportunity to experience such an interesting sport! Operating Hours: Every day (except Mondays) Weekdays: 14:00 - 22:30 Weekends and national holidays: 10:00 - 20:00
strTitle: Have an Amazing Trampoline Experience at Trampoland in Tokyo

strIntroduction: Have you ever wore a robot suit? At Cyberdyne in Tsukuba, Ibaraki, you can! Cyberdyne is a robotic company focused on creating technology that can seamlessly coexist with people. Among their most notable inventions is a robot named HAL. It is the world's first cyborg-type robot as it enables, supports and enhances the wearer's body movements. It was designed to assists a physically challenged people to move freely, and enable him/her to exert bigger motor energy than usual. In this tour, you can actually try on this high-technology robot! The tour includes a 10-minute brief introductory talk about the company, Cyberdyne, then a short lesson about HAL's mechanism and how to wear it. Then you are actually going to wear HAL. Don't worry there will be an assistant who will take you through the whole process. Have fun with HAL enhancing your movements by sitting-down, standing-up, and walking around.
strTitle: Experience Japan's robot technology at Cyberdyne in Tsukuba!

The experience takes about 1 and half hour. The meal will take about an hour. You don't need anything to bring. Choose the starting time when you book: 10:30 for lunch or 17:00 for dinner. Please, check them also from our profile. Thank you!
strTitle: Experience Shakuhachi instrument & Kaiseki meal in Chiba

Yokobue is a very difficult instrument but it is easy to experience with good instructions from a master. The yokobue experience takes about 1 and half hour. The meal will take about an hour. strTitle: Experience Yokobue Japanese flute and Kaiseki meal in Chiba

strIntroduction: First, you will wear the uniform of Aikido. It looks like the Judo uniform. So, please tell us your body size and height when you book. If you are not comfortable with it, you can bring your training wear. Aikido uses opponent's power. You don't have to be a macho man to learn this. To control your spirit, power is the key. This experience will make you feel strong for sure. Child of over 7 can attend. The experience takes about 1 and half hour. The meal will take about an hour. You don't need anything to bring but if you are uncomfortable with changing in uniform, please bring your own training wear. The schedule might change every month. We think food makes your body healthier and we serve only good food for you. strIntroduction: The Seto Inland Sea, or simply the Setouchi, is a peaceful inland sea known as a kayaking paradise. The unique granite shoreline and off-shore islands always offer a great day of discoveries and adventure! If conditions permit, you can explore sea caves that can be approached by kayaks only. We will stop for a break or lunch at one of the local bays enjoying the peace and tranquility of this remote location. Take a walk to the highest point of the island where you can see and feel the primitive and spiritual aspect of the Japanese. A giant granite rock with a phallic outlook has been an object of worship as a symbol of family prosperity. + No previous kayaking experience is required. + We use stable double kayaks. + We require a minimum of 2 people for the tour. Choose between a full day or a half day kayaking tour. Itinerary for the full day tour: 9:50 Check in and meet your guide. 10:00 Kayak briefing. 10:30 Kayak from our base. Total kayak time is approximately 4.5 hours with breaks. 12:00 Enjoy lunch on a secluded beach of Tsutajima Island. 16:00 Arrive back to the base. Itinerary for the half day tour: 12:50 Check in and meet your guide. 13:00 Kayak briefing. 13:30 Kayak from our base. 14:30 Enjoy a tea break on a secluded beach of Tsutajima Island. 16:00 Arrive back to the base. This itinerary is an outline only. Your guide may decide to alter this program based on their judgement of weather, sea conditions, client ability and their fitness level. All trips are subject to having sufficient numbers and suitable weather conditions. Please refer to terms and conditions before you make a reservation. Our tour base in Nio, Kagawa prefecture, is facing to the beach where you set out your kayaking or SUP trips. Our base is a traditional Japanese folk house and we have all-necessary facilities; hot shower on site, toilets and luggage storage. Clients can use them without additional cost. Please park your car at Sun Resort NIO car park, just one minute walk away from our base. Need a transport? If you are a small group(2-4 people), ask us about free pick-up from JR Takuma Station, the closest railway station. NOTE:Bad weather may have an effect on the start of your tour, or it may occur during the tour. We reserve the right to cancel trips or alter schedules if weather conditions are not suitable for group safety. If we consider sea or weather conditions to be too difficult or unsafe, we do not launch the kayaks. We basically make a judgement at the time of 7:00 (for morning tours), 11:00 (for afternoon tours) and 2 hours prior to sunset trips on the date you have reserved. Then we contact you by using phone to explain about the condition. Therefore, please let us know an accessible number for urgent communication. Only when we know that the running of the tour is obviously difficult beforehand such as typhoons we contact you as soon as we decide cancellation.
strTitle: Embark on a Sea Kayaking Adventure in the Seto Inland Sea!

strIntroduction: This is a rare opportunity to experience the Japanese stage art Rakugo in English during your visit to Osaka! Rakugo is verbal entertainment with a storyteller and comic stories, popular among Japanese people and with a history of over 400 years. In this activity you can enjoy the art of Rakugo in English and even become a stage actor for an hour! Below is a greeting message from the Rakugo artists and instructor who will lead you to the wonderful world of Japanese comedy art: Hi, I am Sayohime, an English Rakugo performer! Rakugo is one of the traditional Japanese performing arts. It's a sit-down comic monologue with a history of over 400 years. I have been performing Rakugo in English not only in Japan but also in foreign countries since 2002. My English Rakugo class is located in an education center in Umeda, Osaka, one of Osaka’s most convenient areas. (5 min. walk from JR Osaka station) My goal is to provide a Rakugo experience in English and follow the motto “Humor is universal”. My 60-min.class includes: 1. Introduction and demonstration about Rakugo history, Rakugo rules (12 min.) 2. Sayohime’s English Rakugo performance (20 min) 3. Your English Rakugo performance on the stage You will become a Rakugo performer at the end of the class. I would be happy to answer any questions after the class. Time slots available: 3:30 pm - 4:30 pm 4:45 pm - 5:45 pm Only on the the first and third Thursday of the month. Let's have fun together and perform Rakugo!
strTitle: Experience sit-down comedy Rakugo in English in Osaka!

strIntroduction: This is a 2-day bus tour from Tokyo to popular cherry blossom sites in Nagano prefecture. Visit all 7 castle sites (including currently existing castles registered as national treasures) and see the beautiful sakura blossoms in Nagano! Stay at the famous Akakura Onsen and taste a delicious dinner with spring delicacies! Night illuminations viewing at one of Japan's best cherry blossom spots is included too! Below is the schedule of this tour: Day 1 7:30 to 8:30 am: Shinjuku Station (departure by limited express train) - arrive at Kofu Station and go to Kofu Castle by bus (30 min) - visit the Komoro Castle Ruins and the Kaikoen Park (30 min) - visit the Ueda Castle Ruins Park (famous for the 2016 NHK drama "Sanadamaru") (60 min) - visit the Matsushiro Castle Ruins (40 min) - stay at Akakura Onsen (visit to Takada Castle illuminations during the illumination period) Day 2 - visit Matsumoto Castle, a national treasure (60 min) - visit Takato Castle Site Park (45 min) - visit Takeda Jinja Shrine (30 min) - back to Kofu Station and take limited express train to Shinjuku 19:30 to 21:05: arrival at Shinjuku Station, end of tour This tour is provided by YOKOSO Japan Tour Check the Tour Conditions link below. http://voyag.in/2diT9k2

strIntroduction: This tour is available for guests of at least 6 years of age. Reservation must be completed at least 5 days prior the tour date. This tour is available every day, even on rainy days. The rickshaw has a roof as well as side windows and waterproof cover to keep you dry (days of non-operation may occur due to extreme circumstances, such as earthquakes, typhoons, etc.) A maximum of 2 people can ride one rickshaw. The rickshaw route can and may be customized depending on your interests. Drop-off service is available for the following locations: Kaminarimon, Asakusa Station, Tokyo Skytree. After the rickshaw ride in Asakusa are free to explore Asakusa for the day in your kimono. In case you would like to wear the kimono for an entire day, we strongly recommend to come and get changed early. Expecting mothers in their first 16 weeks of pregnancy are not permitted to ride the rickshaw! Also, the ride is not recommended for babies under six months old.

strIntroduction: In this tour you will dress in Japanese kimono and visit some famous sightseeing places in Tokyo recommended by the guide! Here is a list of places that I will take you to: - Asakusa. You can change into Kimono and experience traditional Japanese fashion. You might want to take pictures. After changing your clothes, you can walk and eat at Nakamise street which looks like old Tokyo from the Edo period. If you want, you can pull a good luck charm called Omikuji at Sensoji Temple. This is the best spot if you like the image of old Japan. - Ueno Park. It's a cultural mecca with a number of museums including the prestigious Tokyo National Museum and the delightful Shitamachi Museum with its display of old Tokyo. Here you'll find also Japan's oldest zoo - Ueno Zoo - and many galleries. We will also go around Shinobazu Pond and around the park. - Shibuya. Here is the most famous scramble intersection. You can visit many attractive shops. - Izakaya "Watami" (bring cash with you). This is a Japanese bar called Izakaya. You can spend great time here. We promise you reasonable prices. Izakaya is a Japanese-style pub popular among working people, which offers a variety of foods.
strTitle: Wear a kimono while strolling around famous spots in Tokyo

strIntroduction: While Japan is renowned around the world for its healthy, unique, and delicious cuisine, it is not all about elegant and pricey sushi or the nurture-balance meal set at home. Just like in any country in the world, Japanese street food has become an increasingly popular way for people to learn about its rich culture. Let's begin our food journey in the evening at the street vendors often seen in every corner of this city, starting at the Yakitori Alley near Yurakucho. Yakitori is bite-sized pieces of chicken skewered on a bamboo skewer, barbecued over a charcoal grill and dipped into a special sauce. Try a sample portion accompanied with sake or local beer while listening to the guide explain the history of this popular snack food. Next, head to Monja Street in Tsukishima where you can enjoy the food while watching how the famous monjayaki is made. Monjayaki is a Japanese pan-fried batter with various choices of chopped ingredients such as vegetables, fish or chicken on top. The food tour cannot be complete without a dessert, let's have a try of wagashi - famous Japanese sweets mainly made from rice powder and red beans, but comes in such a wide range of shape and size, representing the infinite creativity and the love for beauty of Japanese people. Take a bite on Taiyaki - Japanese fish-shaped cake, with the most common filling is red bean paste made from sweetened azuki beans. By the end of the tour, please feel free to discover the night life of Tokyo by getting into some local restaurants, bars or clubs with our useful guide and tips.
strTitle: Go on a street food tour around Tokyo by night!

strIntroduction: Whether drawn into the deep-rooted traditional culture of Tokyo or have a soft spot for its unique architecture, this tour is just for you! For a dash of the rich history embedded in the ancient works, as well as the unique contemporary culture as represented in the youth fashion, on this tour, you can have a chance to get access to the diverse style of Tokyo city. First, after meeting up at the designated location, the tour will start at Meiji Jingu Shrine. Here you can learn about the traditional Japanese architecture and how much influence it has on the modern style. Continue to Harajuku, and you can delve yourselves into the unique youth culture of Tokyo by visiting fashion boutiques and trendy cafés there before moving to Omotesando, where you can see the grand structures of luxurious brands such as Louis Vuitton, Dior and Prada. Finally, the tour ends at Minoru Mori Tower, Roppongi Hills. Here you can have a good comparison with the traditional Japanese architecture by visiting the district full of towering offices, apartments, modern restaurants and hotels; there you can also learn about the philosophy behind postmodern art movements as demonstrated by Takashi Murakami - an internationally well-known contemporary artist, visit the work of Tadao Ando at 21-21 Design Sight, and end the tour by looking through the 54-story Mori Tower.
strTitle: Join a very interesting Art & Architectural tour in Tokyo

strIntroduction: Have an amazing experience in our private/ small group (4 persons max) tour! ・Half day tour 1 pm: pick up from Tsukuba Station 1:45pm: Visit Mt. Tsukuba Shrine 2:30pm: Inaba Shuzou brewety tour - Tour inside the brewety - Meet our female brewer - Sake tasting (3 different sake set) (about an hour and a half) 4:00 pm: Return to the station and end of tour ・1 day tour 9 am: pick up from Tsukuba Station 9:45 am: Visit Mt. Tsukuba Shrine 10:00 am: Hike to top of the mountain (about 90min) 12:00 pm: Take the mountain cablecar back to the Shrine 12:15 pm: Lunch break (lunch fee is not included) 1 pm: pick up from Tsukuba Station 1:45 pm: Visit Mt. Tsukuba Shrine 2:30 pm: Inaba Shuzou brewery tour - Tour inside the brewery - Meet our female brewer - Sake tasting (3 different sake set) (about an hour and a half) 4:00 pm: Return to the station and end of tour You can also book the tours with the special add-on photo service. Photo service: half day tour 1,000 JPY (30-50 photos, 10 edited photos) 1 day tour 2,000 JPY (50-80 photos, 30 edited photos) all in high resolution. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ About me: I'm Misaki, and I'm from Japan. I am a travel lover, and have been to more than 10 counties and have lived in California, Vietnam and Cambodia before. Since my family owns a 150-years-old Sake brewery in Tsukuba, which is just an hour away from Tokyo, I would like to host Sake brewery tour to those who are interested in experiencing Japanese traditional culture during your stay in Japan! About Inaba Shuzou (稲葉酒造): We have been brewing Sake called "Minanogawa (男女川)" since Edo era at the foot of Mt. Tsukuba, surrounded by fresh air and blessing well water in our backyard. Minanogawa is a name of the river flowing in the center of the mountain. Mt. Tsukuba itself is known for being a spiritual power spot and the nature is still well preserved. In the middle of Mt. Tuskuba, there's a shrine and we have been offering our sake since the beginning of our brewery. My mom succeeded the family brewery when she was 35 years old and became a touji (master sake brewer) of Inaba Shuzou. A female sake brewer is very rare in Japan! Our brewery is very small, and still keeps the original building; it has mud wall and thick tree pillars, not only that, but we still keep the traditional handcraft way to brew the authentic sake. Please come through Inaba Shuzou and taste the non-machinery, addictive free, REAL Sake! Tsukuba: 45 min by Tsukuba Express from Akihabara (1,150 JPY). Pick up from the station. 4 persons max a day. Price: per person. ※If you include kids or underage person, please let me know in advance.
strTitle: Tour a 150-year-old Sake Brewery and/or Hike Mt Tsukuba

strIntroduction: Enjoy an exclusive tour through the rich and historical city of Kyoto. A maximum of 12 people can attend this tour, so you will really feel the atmosphere of this traditional city with a knowledgeable and English-speaking guide, You will start your tour at one of the city's must-see hot spots: Tōfukuji Temple, which was built in the 13th century. Admire how the elements of the earth, sand, rock and moss come together to create natural and beautiful art. Contemplate the purpose of Zen from a shaded and serene spot and imagine what it must have been like in the 13th century where others stood where you stand now. Learn about the origin and inspiration for the garden, and what it means to the Monks who continue to live and study here. Next, you will head to Fushimi Inari Shrine, nestled at the base of the tree-covered mountainside. Count the numerous fox statues, which are considered messengers of the Gods. Pass through the winding red torii gates that stretch for miles up the mountain. Finally, at twilight, head towards the twinkling lights of Gion. This is Kyoto's gathering spot for Geisha and features many historic and traditional restaurants, tea houses and theaters. These are all combined with Japan's traditional architecture and ancient Kyoto entertainment. Keep an eye out for a flash for white make up or an elaborate up do, you may just see a rare and beautiful Geisha rushing by.
strTitle: Walk Through Traditional City of Kyoto with English Guide!

strIntroduction: This is a special spring tour in which you will visit some of Japan's most famous sakura cherry blossom spots that can be seen in Miyagi prefecture, Tohoku. There is no better tour to feel the coming of the spring season! About the places included in the tour: 1. Ogawara's Thousand Sakura Trees at Funaoka Park This place is included in the selection of Japan's Best 100 cherry blossom spots. The sakura trees growing along the river have been planted in 1923. There are 1000 trees and the cherry blossoms in spring have become the symbol of the local town. During the sakura festival in April many food stalls are open. The park becomes lively with many visitors, and some of the attractions to try are a boat cruise on the river and a trip with a rickshaw. 2. Hotel Matsushima Onsen Ichinobo This hotel will impress you with its luxurious interior and an open-air hot spring pool overlooking the ocean. 3. Matsushima Bay: Zuiganji Temple, Entsuin Temple, Godaido Hall, Kanrantei tea house Enjoy strolling around the scenic Matsushima Bay and discover several famous temples from the era of the local feudal lord Date Masamune. You can also experience copying sutra, hands-on activities, grean tea, as well as eating delicious local seafood. Below is the itinerary for this relaxing tour to the countryside towns: Day 1 8:20 - Take Shinkansen Hayabusa 5 from Tokyo to Sendai Station, and then change to the local JR Tohoku line bound for Shiroishi until you reach Ogawara Station. Get off at Ogawara Station. 10:36 - Walk around the town and see the park of thousand sakura trees. Enjoy the sakura festival by a river boat or a rickshaw ride. Have lunch at the food stalls. 14:15 - Take the train from Ogawara Station to Sendai Station and then change to the local JR Senseki line for Matushima Kaigan Station. Get off at Matsushima Kaigan Station and get picked up by a shuttle bus to your hotel. Check in at Hotel Matsushima Onsen Ichinobo which will impress you with its luxurious interior and an open-air hot spring pool overlooking the ocean. Day 2 9:30 - Get picked up from the hotel and go to Matsushima seaside area to explore the town's historical wonders on foot: the gorgeous temples Zuiganji and Entsuin, which have attractive Japanese-style gardens, the Buddhist relic Godaido Hall, the tea house Kanrantei and much more! Enjoy hands-on activities and eat fresh seafood for lunch. You can leave your luggage at the station's coin lockers during sightseeing. 16:21 - Go to Matsushima-Kaigan Station where the tour ends. Recommended return trip to Tokyo: take the local train departing at 16:21 from Matsushima-Kaigan Station and arrive at Sendai at 16:49. Then take the Shinkansen bullet train at 17:09 and arrive in Tokyo at 18:52. Accommodation and meals (1 lunch on Day 2, 1 dinner, 1 breakfast) are included. This is a private tour specially for you. This is a specially designed tour that you can book only with us. You will not find this tour at any other travel company. Try it as a 2-day trip during your visit in Japan and discover hidden beautiful places that do no appear in standard guide books and travel packages. This tour is available only between April 7 and April 21.
strTitle: Visit famous sakura cherry blossom spots in Miyagi in 2 days

strIntroduction: There are many traditional temples and shrines such as Sensōji Temple, Matsuchiyama Shoden Temple, Asakusa Shrine, Imado Shrine and etc. These temples and shrines host at least one festival or matsuri a year. Therefore Asakusa is famous for its frequent matsuri or festival. The largest and most popular one is the Sanja Matsuri which is held in late May. There are various restaurants in Asakusa, which specialize in Japanese cuisine such as Tempura, Sushi, Sukiyaki, eel which fulfil your appetite. Furthermore you’ll be attracted by popular local specialties sold by about 89 shops, lining on the street which is called Nakamise-dōri. As I mentioned above, Asakusa provides you with such diverse and attractive spots that you won’t feel disappointed. But one thing that might depress you is you might have not enough time to experience all of them as a tourist. So I believe I can guide you to Sensōji Temple and Asakusa Shrine which are the spots that you definitely must visit on this tour. The Sensōji Temple The Sensōji Temple is a Buddhist temple. It is the main feature of Asakusa and one of the most popular tourist attractions in Tokyo. The temple is dedicated to the bodhisattva Kannon. So the Sensoji is also known as Asakusa-Kannon and about 30 million visitors visit every year. It was established in 628 and it's the oldest temple in Tokyo. The Asakusa Shrine The Asakusa Shrine, also known as Sanja-sama, literally "Shrine of the Three gods", is one of the most famous Shinto shrines in Tokyo and famous for its annual festival Sanja Matsuri, held in late May. The shrine honors the three men (Hajino Nakamoto and HInokuma brothers, Hamanari and Takenari) who established and constructed the Sensō-ji.
strTitle: Walk around the finest parts of Asakusa district, Tokyo

strIntroduction: Himiko and Hotaluna are two futuristic water buses running from Asakusa to Toyosu in Odaiba Seaside Park and then back to Asakusa. Designed by renowned Japanese cartoonist, Reiji Matsumoto, these unique boats have been designed to fire the imagination of children, and the child in us all. With their sleek silver bodies and window frames, they look like spaceships as they cruise the Sumida River, giving panoramic views of old Edo and modern Tokyo. At night, their sophisticated lighting systems make them glow as they glide through the water. Himiko is named for Queen Himiko who, about 2000 years ago, was the first woman in power in Japanese history. Even today, schoolchildren learn about the reign and legacy of Queen Himiko. The name Hotaluna comes from hotaru (firefly) and Luna (the moon Goddess). This name evokes images of a great firefly glowing in the dark. Likewise, this water bus and its lighting panels illuminate the water around its course. Surely, there is no more romantic or exciting way to reach Odaiba than on Himiko or Hotaluna! Odaiba is a large man-made island in Tokyo bay, famous for its many shops and entertainment spots, as well as spectacular views of the bay and Rainbow Bridge. It is also one of the few places in the region with access to a beach. Not surprisingly, Odaiba has become a popular venue for dating couples as there is so much to do and see, you could easily spend a whole weekend wandering around. Himiko's route is the following: Asakusa - Odaiba - Toyosu (only some boats continue to Toyosu) Timetable: Asakusa departure: 10:10, 13:25, 15:25, (17:20 - irregular departure) Odaiba departure: 12:20, 14:20, (16:15 - to Toyosu only) Not operating every second Tuesday and the following day. Hotaluna's route is the following: Asakusa - Hinode Pier - Odaiba Timetable: Asakusa departure: 10:00, 13:15, 15:15, (17:30 - irregular departure) Odaiba departure: 11:10, 14:25, (16:25 - irregular departure), (18:40 - irregular departure) Not operating every third Wednesday and the following day.
strTitle: Enjoy an exciting water bus ride on the Sumida river, Tokyo!

strIntroduction: Kamakura is a coastal town in Kanagawa Prefecture, less than an hour south of Tokyo. Kamakura became the political center of Japan when Minamoto Yoritomo chose the city as the seat for his new military government in 1192. The Kamakura government continued to rule Japan for over a century, first under the Minamoto shogun and then under the Hojo regents. Today, Kamakura is a small city and a very popular tourist destination. Sometimes called the Kyoto of Eastern Japan, Kamakura offers numerous temples, shrines and other historical monuments. We offer you a private vehicle service so you can move between popular sightseeing spots easily. You start the tour in Tokyo in the morning and come back to Tokyo in the evening. Schedule Details: - 09:00 Central Tokyo Area pick up. - 10:30-12:00 Tsurugaoka Hachimangu Tsurugaoka Hachimangu is Kamakura's most important shrine. It was founded by Minamoto Yoriyoshi in 1063, and enlarged and moved to its current site in 1180 by Minamoto Yoritomo, the founder and first shogun of the Kamakura government. - 12:00-13:00 Lunch at Komachi-dori Street Komachi-dori Street spreads from the rotary in front of Kamakura station to the north toward Tsurugaoka Hachimangu. The street is lined with over 250 restaurants, boutiques, fancy cafes, Japanese-style sweet cafes, and stores selling souvenirs and sundry articles unique to the ancient city. - 13:30-14:30 Hasedera Temple (Hase Kannon Temple) (Admission Fee: Adult JPY 300/Child JPY 100) Hasedera is a temple of the Jodo sect, that is most famous for its statue of Kannon, the goddess of mercy. The statue shows Kannon with eleven heads, each representing a characteristic of the goddess. - 14:30-15:30 Great Buddha (Admission Fee: Adult 200 JPY/Child 150 JPY) The Great Buddha of Kamakura (Kamakura Daibutsu) is a bronze statue of Amida Buddha, which stands on the grounds of Kotokuin Temple. With a height of 13.35 meters, it is the second tallest bronze Buddha statue in Japan, surpassed only by the statue in Nara's Todaiji Temple. - 17:00 Central Tokyo Area drop off. strIntroduction: On this 1-day Iga highway bus tour, you can be like a ninja in the Iga-Ueno area of Mie prefecture! Visiting places such as the Iga-Ueno Tourism association, Ueno Park, Ninja Museum of Igaryu, Iga-Ueno castle, and more in the area. A ninja or shinobi was a covert agent from the Kamakura Period to the Edo Period and is now well-known all over the world. During this tour you will experience various activities related to ninja such as dressing-up as a ninja, throwing shuriken (ninja star), watching a ninja show and seeing real ninja items in a ninja museum, among others. The Iga-ryu Ninja House located in the Ninja Museum of Igaryu will be one of the most exciting spots in Iga-Ueno if you would like to experience how ninjas lived in the old days. In order to prevent things being stolen by enemies, this kind of Ninja house had inbuilt protections such as traps, fake hallways, secret escape routes, hidden doors, and places to hide swords. On the tour you can explore those things on your own! The Ninja museum of Igaryu has a Ninja Experience Hall, Ninja Tradition Hall, Original Ninja Goods Shop and a Ninja show, making for an exciting experience. Iga-Ueno castle, which is also known as Hakuho castle, has a 30 meter high stone wall,is one of the highest in Japan, and was elected as Iga City’s Tangible Cultural Property in 1985, inside which you can see traditional Japanese armor. On this tour you will get tickets which can be exchanged for various things at Iga-Ueno. There are 12 restaurants you can choose from and where you can use 2 tickets to eat for free. You may choose from sweets such as “Katayaki” or “Decchi-Yokan” or from other desserts, pickled vegetables or alcohol beverages. “Katayaki” is sweet and well-known as the hardest rice cracker. “Decchi-Yokan” is beloved by the locals of Iga and is a very sweet and soft sweet jellied adzuki-bean paste. Explore Iga-Ueno area with this 1-Day tour! This tour is available everyday. Itinerary: 08:35/10:05 Take the bus at Meitetsu Bus Center near Nagoya Station Explore Iga-Ueno area (max 9 hours) Area includes; Iga-Ueno Tourism association, Ueno Park, Ninja Museum of Igaryu, Iga-Ueno castle, etc. 14:07/16:07/18:07/20:07 This tour ends at Meitetsu Bus center. You may choose when you would like to come back from the times above.
strTitle: Enjoy 1-Day All-About-Ninja Tour in Mie, from Nagoya

strIntroduction: Beginning at Nagoya Station, this bus tour includes a ride to Kamagatani Valley, also known as Kamagatani Gorge. Lying at the base of Mt Ikeda in Gifu Prefecture, Kamagatani Valley is famous for its cherry blossoms and is considered one of Japan's Top 100 cherry blossom viewing locations. Take a leisurely stroll through the natural beauty of the cherry trees. After this, you will be taken to Sekigahara for lunch - all-you-can-eat, succulent crab dishes, including crab legs and claws, crab sushi, crab porridge and Crab soup, to name just a few of the delicacies provided! After lunch, you will be taken to Nagahama to pick strawberries, as many as you can in 30 minutes! After this, shop for Konbu-kan seafood products before going on to the Nihonkai Sakana-kaido, the largest fish market on the Sea of Japan coast. With establishments selling all kinds of seafood and souvenirs. After this take a look at Kamaboko shop, a kind of steamed seafood cake, sometimes called Japanese fish-cake. It is an important part of many Japanese dishes, especially soba and udon noodles. Limited language support in English or Chinese may be available if bookings are made sufficiently far in advance. The schedule of the tour is as follows: 8:40 am: Depart from Nagoya Station - visit Kamagatani Valley - visit Sekigahara and have lunch (50 min) - visit Nagahama and pick strawberries (30 min) - visit Konbu-kan - visit a seafood shop - visit a Kamaboko, fish cake shop 19:10 pm: return to Nagoya Station, end of tour This tour is provided by YOKOSO Japan Tour Check the Tour Conditions link below. http://voyag.in/2diT9k2
strTitle: Enjoy Strawberries, Crab & Cherry Blossoms tour in Nagoya

strIntroduction: Beginning at Nagoya Station, this one day tour includes a bus ride to Fukuroi, a great spot for souvenir shopping; then to Kakegawa where you can pick all the strawberries you can in 30 minutes! Then you go on to Ieyama Station by bus, giving you 20 minutes or so to view the Cherry Blossom Tunnel before boarding the Oigawa Railway steam train for an exciting 20 minute journey through the Cherry Blossom Tunnel! A bento, Japanese box style lunch, is included. As with many places in the world, steam trains are becoming rarer in Japan. However, the Oigawa Railway line, running along the Oi River continues to use steam locomotives. These endearing trains really have a chance to sparkle during the cherry blossom season, when they can be seen running through a tunnel of cherry blossoms. This is one of Japan's most delightful cherry blossom spots, where the scenery can best be enjoyed from inside a carriage of the steam train. Of course, train spotters and photographers love the view from outside too, as the trains pass through the cherry blossoms. For this reason, it has become known as the Cherry Blossom Tunnel. The schedule of the tour is as follows: 9:20 am: Depart from Nagoya Station - go by bus to Shin-Kanaya Station and take the steam locomotive on the Oigawa railway line - see the sakura blossoms at Ieyama Station (40 min) - go to Kakegawa for strawberry picking (30 min) 19:10 pm: return to Nagoya Station This tour is provided by YOKOSO Japan Tour Check the Tour Conditions link below. http://voyag.in/2diT9k2
strTitle: Enjoy a Steam Locomotive, Cherry Blossom tour from Nagoya

strIntroduction: Sakura (Cherry Blossom) Viewing is one of the biggest annual events in Spring in Japan. We, Japanese, have picnics under the trees and enjoy viewing the beautiful Cherry Blossom and drinking. Let's enjoy Tokyo's cherry blossoms at a quiet place together with locals and other foreigners on a picnic! Please bring your own food and drinks, or you can buy something from the nearby stores. This activity is usually offered as a group tour with other locals and foreigners, but if you wish, I can guide you privately.
strTitle: Come to a Cherry Blossom Viewing Picnic in Central Tokyo

strIntroduction: Tokyo is Japan's capital and most populous city. It is a mixture of old and new. You can visit the bustling and hectic metropolis saturated with neon lights, high rise buildings and crowds of fashion-oriented people but at the same time, explore the back-alleys and see quaint temples, traditional stalls selling local products, and peaceful parks providing a restful haven for people in this city. Spend one day exploring the city in a bus tour that will take you to its famous sightseeing spots. Stroll around a traditional Japanese garden at the Imperial Palace before visiting the must-see sights of Sensoji temple and Kaminari-mon gate in Asakusa. Next, visit Tsukiji Market, the biggest and busiest fish market in Japan. Experience a 20-minute cruise in the scenic Tokyo bay and end your tour by shopping in Odaiba. The bus will also pass-by the National Diet Building, Ameyoko open-air market, Tokyo Skytree, Kabuki-za Theater before bringing you back to Shinjuku. The following day, escape the bustling city and visit Mount Fuji. In this 1-day bus tour, you will get a chance to explore Japan's top tourist draw and a UNESCO World Heritage sight. You shall also visit Lake Kawaguchi, one of Fuji Goko (Five Fuji Lakes) and famous for the best view of Mt. Fuji in this area and Oshino Ninja Village a Ninja theme park that was opened in 2015. As a bonus, you will also be able to experience a 4D movie at Fuji-Q Highland which simulates an airplane flying over Mt. Fuji. Enough free time will also be given for you to visit places in Tokyo under your bucket list, try out authentic Japanese cuisine, and shop for souvenirs. For more information, check-out the itinerary of this package below: Day 1 Pick-up from Narita or Haneda Airport and transfer to Hotel Mystays Nishi Shinjuku Day 2 8:30 Depart from the meeting point at Shinjuku (The meeting point is Shinjuku Island Tower at 8:20) 9:00-9:40 Imperial Palace East Garden Relax and feel the breeze in the greenery. 10:15-11:05 Sensoji Temple, Asakusa Explore one of the most famous temples in Japan! 11:45-12:20 Tsukiji Fish Market Enjoy world famous fish market in the tour. 12:50-13:10 Tokyo Bay Cruise See the fascinating view of Tokyo Bay! 13:30-14:45 Aqua City Odaiba Enjoy shopping, not to forget this fantastic memory of the tour! 16:00 The final stop is Shinjuku Station south exit. Day 3 8:10 Depart from the meeting point in Shinjuku (The meeting point is Shinjuku Island Tower) 9:45-10:05 Lake Kawaguchi Enjoy the natural reflecting pool for Mt. Fuji! 10:40-11:10 Oshino Hakkai (Oshino Eight Ponds) See the beautiful ponds with the view of Mt.Fuji! 11:20-12:35 Oshino Shinobi no Sato (Oshino Ninja Village) Explore traditional Japanese culture and take photos with Ninja! 13:40-14:10 Mt. Fuji 5th Station Get the closest view of Mt.Fuji and take photos that you can show it off to your friends! 14:50-15:30 4D experience at Fuji-Q Highland This will definitely be one of the most astonishing experience in this tour! 17:00-17:30 End of the tour at Shinjuku Station south exit Day 4 Free-time for sightseeing and shopping Day 5 Pick-up at Hotel Mystays Nishi Shinjuku and transfer to Narita or Haneda Airport *** IMPORTANT INFORMATION *** 1) Weekend rates apply if any of the traveling date falls on a weekend. 2) Booking must be made two (2) weeks prior to the tour 3) This tour package is not available on the following dates: April 29 to May 8, 2016; August 12 to 15, 2016; and December 29, 2016 to January 2, 2017

strIntroduction: Kawana Hotel is classic hotel established in 1928, which is located in Shizuoka prefecture. With its fantastic view of the Pacific and two wonderful world class golf courses, Kawana Hotel warmly welcomes both golfers and non-golfers. The two amazing world class golf courses are Fuji course and Oshima course, among these, Fuji course is one of the best golf courses in Japan. Opened for play in 1936, Fuji course was designed by Charles Hugh Alison, a worldwide famous golf course architect from Britain. Kawana Hotel's Fuji course ranked 1st in Central Japan region, 2nd in Japan, and 53rd in the world. Fuji course is famous for its breathtaking view of the Pacific Sea from the cliff tops, and astounding view of the mature woodland and Mt. Fuji on the backcloth. Fuji course is also famous for its challenging and outstanding golf holes. Kawana Hotel's Fuji course is a favorite of many Japanese and overseas guests. Famous celebrities like Marilyn Monroe and Joe DiMaggio have spent several days at Kawana Hotel in the past. This program offers you the golf tour packs for Fuji Golf Course at Kawana Hotel. The tour packs include previous night accommodation, breakfast, golf course fee, and caddy service. The details of the golf tour packs are as follows: -The Mountain Side This tour pack includes previous night accommodation, breakfast, golf course fee, and caddy service. You will be staying in a twin room with the mountain view. - The Ocean Side This tour pack includes previous night accommodation, breakfast, golf course fee, and caddy service. You will be staying in a twin room with the ocean view. Please note that this tour is available only on the weekdays, and if more than two guests are staying in the twin room, an extra bed will be provided. You can choose either Japanese or Western food for breakfast. Kawana Hotel's Fuji Golf Course is very famous both in Japan and all over the world. Reservation is difficult to make, so we recommend you to use our reservation service to secure a booking. Hurry and book this program to experience golfing at a world class golf course at Kawana Hotel's Fuji Golf Course!
strTitle: Reservation for Golf Tour Pack at Kawana Hotel in Shizuoka!

strIntroduction: The shinkansen rail network in Japan is famous around the world for its punctuality, comfort, efficiency, safety and speed. With top speeds around 320 km/h, Japan Rail's bullet train, or shinkansen, is an experience in its own right, as well as a great way to travel. This program is a reservation for shinkansen bullet train ticket in between Osaka/Kyoto with a half day or one day private tour guide. The tour guide will arrange the trip schedule, so you can request the guide to include the places that you would like to visit. Some famous sightseeing spots for Kyoto are as follows: - Kinkaku-ji Temple Kinkaku-ji, the famed “Golden Pavilion,” is Kyoto’s most iconic sight, rising above its reflecting pond like an apparition, - Ginkaku-ji Temple Ginkaku-ji temple, the “Silver Pavilion”, has magnificient halls and gardens, with a tremendous viewpoint over the entire temple compound - Kiyomizu-dera Temple Kiyomizu-dera Temple is one of Kyoto’s must-see attractions. It’s a bustling riot of commerce and schlock, but it’s a lot of fun, especially for the kids. - Nijo-jo Castle Nijo-jo Castle is one of Kyoto’s most popular and impressive sights. It shows the power that the Shoguns wielded over the emperors throughout the Edo Period ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ※ Important Ticket Delivery & Pickup Information - Please Read Carefully ※ 1. Ticket Delivery We will deliver your tickets to your hotel in advance for your concierge to hold for you. The tickets will be available upon check-in. If you would like us to deliver the tickets to your hotel, please provide us with the following information: - Hotel name - The full name used for your reservation - Check-in date Please note: - We require at least 3 full business days for delivery. If placing a last minute booking within 3 days of your visit, or if you do not provide us your hotel information at least 3 full business days prior your ticket date, you'll need to collect your tickets from our Tokyo office in Shibuya. - If your hotel reservation details change, please tell us immediately through the Voyagin dashboard. - We only deliver to hotels with a concierge with whom we can confirm the receipt of the ticket delivery. We do not deliver tickets to hostels, guesthouses, or private residences. Please let us know if you are not staying at a hotel so we can provide our office details for you to pickup the tickets. 2. Ticket Pickup: If you are not staying at a hotel, book within 3 days of the ticket date, or prefer to pickup your tickets, you can collect your tickets from our Tokyo office in Shibuya. Our office is located 6 minutes (on foot) from Shibuya station.
